loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in growing rice crop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is sixty years old and has recently started a business selling chocolates, candies, and yaniqueques ("Johnny cakes"), a fried dough snack, in her community. Each day, Mercedes sets out all of her treats on her display table, and passers-by stop along the sidewalk to enjoy Mercedes’ delicious snacks.

Mercedes is excited about investing in her business and adding a wider variety of candies and sweets to her stock. At the same time, Mercedes’ husband is no longer physically able to work, and she is nervous about the challenge of supporting her family. Mercedes hopes that her investment will continue her business’ growth and that, perhaps, eventually, she can even buy some nicer furniture for her home.

loans.use: Purchase of new cooking materials and candies and other sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for farming of rice crop and care for herd of pigs.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is thirty-four years old and the mother of two boys, ages ten and twelve, both of whom attend school. Her husband works at a nearby hotel. To supplement her family’s income, Mirian sells an assortment of women’s shoes and slippers. Most of her customers are friends and neighbors in her community, but Mirian also travels to Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic, to sell her shoes.

Mirian is excited about the opportunity to increase the sizes and styles of her shoe inventory with her loan. She explains that her business will help support her children’s educations and her family’s well being.

loans.use: To buy new sizes and styles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in farming/rice crop and maintenance of livestock.

loans.name: Mapatano A Group

texts.en:
Grace M., age 40, is married and has 3 children (ages 18, 16, and 10). For the past 8 years, she has been running a business selling charcoal and juice. The business is open from 8 am to 3 pm daily, and Grace typically earns a monthly profit of about US$154.

Grace hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who sell sarongs and soft drinks, and run a restaurant, a shop, and saloon.

In the picture, Grace is the first one on the left.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is twenty-seven years old and the very proud mother of six children. She explains that four boys and two girls are hard to keep up with, but she is very proud that they are all in school. Her husband is a construction foreman and travels often.

Doris sells an assortment of kitchenware to the women in her community. Her products include pots and pans, bowls and plates, and other cookware. With her loan, Doris plans to boost her inventory and add fine crystal as well. Doris explains that supporting her children’s education is her most important goal for the future. Doris hopes to attend university herself some day and two of her children have already decided that they want to be professors!

loans.use: Purchase of new kitchenware and crystal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice crop/harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his land for planting rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working his land for his rice crop/harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his rice harvest

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is a small business owner from Bogorodchany, a small town in western Ukraine. She has a business selling women’s clothing, shoes and purses. Her business currently has two locations, a little store in the central part of Bogorodchany and a second sales location she recently opened nearby. This is Lesya’s sixth year of operation. Her business continues to do well and provides a large part of her family’s income. Lesya is married and has two sons.

Lesya has requested a loan of $200 to help purchase a new supply of inventory. She’d like to buy a selection of women’s pants and shirts to retail. Financial assistance that Lesya has received in the past has had a huge impact on her business. We are happy for another opportunity to help her operate a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To increase inventory of women’s pants and shirts

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel makes his living driving a taxi around the city of Khoost in the beautiful western Ukraine. A pleasant mannered young man, operating his own taxi has fulfilled Pavel’s long-term desire to be self-employed. He offers good service to his customers and tries to give them an enjoyable ride. Pavel has been in business for about 2 years. His monthly income is typically around $700, a good middle wage for a single person.

Pavel has requested a six month loan of $500 to help purchase a fare meter for his taxi. These meters allow taxi drivers to more accurately charge for their services based on time and distance rather than set fares. We are happy for this opportunity to help Pavel improve his business and continue his success.

loans.use: To purchase a meter

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a taxi cab driver from the Khoost area in western Ukraine. Married with a little three year old daughter, Roman is able to support his wife and family with his taxi business and a small store he operates. Roman has been driving a taxi for the past three years. He offers good service and low prices to his customers. In a typical month, Roman makes around $750 in profit. 

Roman has requested a loan of $1000 to increase his working capital. His business has benefited from and grown as a result of financial assistance he has received through Nadiya Ukraine. This loan will help him continue to operate a successful and stable enterprise.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Igembe B Group

texts.en:
Sophia S., age 54, is married and has 4 children (ages 34, 32, 28, and 24). For almost a year now, she has been running a business in the sale of whole and retail vouchers. Sophia's business is open from 7:30 am to 6 pm daily, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$85.3.

Sophia now hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of timber, poultry, and games products, and in running a saloon.

In the picture, Sophia is the second one from the left.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia D. D. T. has a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin. She started the store in 1988 as an investment to help her family. Amelia is friendly, charismatic, and loves to work. The store is now the largest in Jepelacio. She sells a large variety of goods, ranging from baby products, medicines, clothes, and school supplies.

Amelia is 60 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. All of her children are adults so she now focuses on helping her grandchildren as much as possible. Amelia is so happy and proud she started her business and what she has accomplished. Over the years, she has maD. many friends and now has a voice in her community.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Amelia is requesting a loan of $625 (s/1800) to repay over 4 months. With the loan, she would like to stock her store with school uniforms and school supplies as the new school year begins soon.

loans.use: She would like to stock her store with school uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Igembe E Group

texts.en:
Nalma J., age 38, is married and has 5 children (ages, 18, 15, 10, 7, and 5). She earns income catching and selling fish which she does once a week. The business allows her to make a monthly profit of around US$3,414.

Nalma hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy fishing nets. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of food products, pork, clothes, charcoal, pharmacy and grocery items, and fish.

In the picture, Nalma is the first one from the left.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Claudia Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina is 38 years old. She is married and has two young sons who are 12 and 14 years old. Her husband is a civil engineer and he works for a construction company. They live in the neighborhood of Anexo Villa Venezuela. Eight years ago Yanina decided to begin a business that would generate income with which she could cover the household costs, her children’s education, and improvements to her house. Her husband’s job is not stable as he is not working as a permanent employee.

It is due to this situation that Yanina decided to work selling traditional crafts, such as hammocks, ceramic jars, wooden chairs, wall decorations, tables, vases, flowers, among other products, to Costa Rica and Honduras. She goes to those countries 2 to 4 times per month. She stays for 3 or 4 days until she sells the last of the products she has.

It is through this type of business, and her husband’s economic contribution, that this family has gotten ahead and has been improving its living and housing conditions. The house is currently unprotected and insecure because Yanina hasn’t finished the wall around it. She needs a loan to finish building the wall in front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Yanina tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 14 años de edad, su esposo es Ingeniero Civil, trabaja en una empresa constructora, habitan en el Anexo Villa Venezuela.Hace 8 años Yanina decidió realizar una actividad que le generara ingresos con los cuales pudiera cubrir los gastos de la casa, la educación de sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, debido que el trabajo de su esposo es inestable, ya que él no se encuentra en una empresa como trabajador permanente. Es debido a esta situación que la señora se dedico a comercializar Artesanía Tradicional como hamacas, jarrones, sillas de maderas, adornos de pared, mesas, floreros, flores, entre otros productos a Costa Rica y Honduras, el cual es visitado de 2 a 4 veces al mes, permanece 3 o 4 días en esos países hasta que venda el último producto que ofrece. Con este tipo de actividad y con el aporte económico de su esposo, es como esta familia ha salido adelante y ha ido mejorando su condición de vida y habitacional de su vivienda, la cual en estos momentos se encuentra desprotegida e insegura, ya que la señora no tiene terminado el muro de su vivienda. Yanina necesita un préstamo para terminar de cerrar el muro de enfrente de su vivienda.

loans.use: To build a wall around her house

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo S. sells vegetables. He started his business as a street vendor, but now his business is situated in his home in the city of Leon, specifically in the El Sauce village.

He is father to three children and his obligation is to provide them with an education they deserve. For this reason Gerardo sacrifices to sell his products and thus continue maintaining his modest family who depend greatly on him. It is necessary to emphasize that despite his modest living, which he has survived for some time now, he has been able to offer his children an education, nourishment, and a proud life.

At the moment, his home is in poor condition. The roof is bare, and he needs to invest in infrastructure desperately. For this reason CEPRODEL has disbursed immediate loans so that he may invest in his business. According to him, the loans have been incredibly helpful in improving his economic situation and in acquiring greater quantities of vegetables for sale. He has procured 5 loans from CEPRODEL, and at the moment he is urgently seeking to purchase vegetables and to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Gerardo S. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras el cual en un inicio ofertaba sus productos ambulantemente pero ahora se ubica en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo El Sauce.

Es padre de tres niñas y su obligación es brindarle la educación que ellas se merecen. Por esta razón es que Gerardo se esfuerza para vender estos productos perecederos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde familia que tanto necesita de el. Es necesario destacar que a pesar de la pobreza que este caballero ha tenido desde mucho tiempo atrás ha logrado mantener a sus hijas brindándoles educación, alimentación y un techo digno.

Actualmente su local no posee buenas condiciones, el techo se encuentra descubierto y por tanto necesita invertir en infraestructura. Es por tal razon que CEPRODEL le ha otorgado créditos inmediatos para invertir en el negocio y según comenta, estos créditos le han servido de mucho bien por el hecho de que ha mejorado su condición económica y ha adquirido mayores cantidades de verduras para comercializarlas. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel y su necesidad es la urgencia de compra de las verduras y de igual forma la mejora de su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Ignacio Gustavo

texts.es:
Ignacio V. is originally from the city of Leon, specifically from the El Sauce municipality which is Leon's most profitable zone.

Ignacio V. sells milk obtained from his own cows. He raises and cares for these cows with great sacrifice so that they can produce milk and thus remain modest in their dependency on Ignacio.

Despite the economic situation he has traversed, he has maintained his business in his home and this he has managed through loans disbursed by Ceprodel. He has used these loans to purchase cows in order to maximize his profit and thus continue maintaining his household. He has asked for two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Ignacio V. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León específicamente del municipio El Sauce que es un lugar muy alejado de la ciudad siendo la zona ganadera de León.

Ignacio V. se dedica a la venta de leche obtenida de sus vacas que con mucho esfuerzo las cuida y alimenta para que produzcan la leche y así mantener a su humilde hogar que tanto necesita de el.

A pesar de la situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, ha logrado mantener sus ventas en su casa de habitación y esto lo ha hecho a través de los créditos brindados en Ceprodel que los ha invertido en la compra de vaquillas para sacarle el máximo provecho para así seguir manteniendo su hogar. Su record crediticio es de dos créditos.

loans.use: To purchase milking cows

loans.name: Kizuian C Group

texts.en:
Neema M., age 31, runs a nursery school and a grocery businesses which she started a year ago. Her businesses are open from 8 am to 5 pm daily, allowing her to make a monthly profit of about US$85.4.

Neema now hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her nursery business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in tailoring and in the sale of food, timber, and meat products.

In the picture, Neema is the second one from the left in the back row.

loans.use: Expansion of a nursing school

loans.name: Marbis Manuel

texts.es:
Marbis C. spent a great part of his youth working as an electrician. However, seeing his difficult economic situation he decided to invest in the purchase of a grinder so as to dedicate himself to this business situated in his home in the El Sauce municipality in Leon.

Since starting this milling business 10 years ago, Marbis has sacrificed a great deal to maintain it, and it is for this reason that he is well recognized in the village. He believes he can better his economic situation since it has always been a dream of his to improve his business with new machinery. To realize this dream Marbis has sought the support of Ceprodel, which as been a great factor in the development of his business by disbursing loans that have been beneficial to the growth of his business and the betterment of his life. His loan record is five loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marbis C. es un caballero que gran parte de su juventud la dedicó al negocio de electricista pero al ver la difícil situación económica que le rodeaba decide invertir en la compra de un molino para dedicarse a este negocio en su casa de habitación en León específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce.

Desde hace 10 años inició este negocio que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mantenerlo y es por eso que hoy en día es muy reconocido en el pueblo y asegura que mejorará su situación económica ya que son sus sueños ampliar el negocio con nueva maquinaria. Para hacer realidad este sueño, el señor C. se ha apoyado de Ceprodel que ha sido un factor importante para el desarrollo de su negocio otorgándole créditos que le han beneficiado en el crecimiento de su negocio y mejora de su nivel de vida. Su record crediticio es de 5 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his mill

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
Mercedes P. is originally from the Sauce municipality in Leon, and she dedicates herself to teaching in a small school in the village. Everyday she walks a long distance to arrive at the school. Despite the difficult economic situation she is going through, she always conveys an excellent spirit to her students.

Mercedes currently finds herself in an urgent situation to invest in the reconstruction of her house. Due to the fact that her teaching job does not allow her to obtain a sufficient income, she seeks support through other means.

For this reason Mercedes approaches Ceprodel for assistance with loans. These loans will be useful in the reconstruction of her home, providing a better way of life for her two young children who greatly deserve this.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes P. es una dama originaria del municipio del Sauce en León y se dedica a la docencia en un pequeño colegio del pueblo. Día a día camina un largo trecho para llegar a este colegio y a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa siempre transmite un espíritu de superación para sus alumnos.

La situación que atraviesa la señora Mercedes es la urgencia de invertir en la reconstrucción de su casa por el hecho de que el trabajo de docencia no le permite obtener estos ingresos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar apoyo por otros medios.

Por tal razón es que la señora Mercedes acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con los créditos que por cierto le han sido de mucha utilidad en la reconstrucción de su casa para así brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto se lo merecen.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the reconstruction of her home

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nubia Garcia is known for being an excellent grade-school teacher, a vocation she has dedicated herself to for 20 years in a small school in the region of El Sauce in the city of Leon.

She has been working hard for a long time to improve her standard of living but unfortunately the salary she earns doesn't permit her the dream to rebuild her house. She needs to rebuild because her home is in poor condition with broken floors and holes in the roof. For this reason she seeks the help of Ceprodel to receive financial support in the form of a loan to be able to realize her dream of rebuilding her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nubia Garcia se caracteriza por ser una excelente maestra de primaria cuya labor la ejerce desde hace 20 años en un pequeño colegio en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León.

Es una dama que por mucho tiempo se ha esforzado para mejorar el estado de su vivienda pero lastimosamente el salario percibido en su negocio de docencia no le permite llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstruir su casa. Es necesario destacar que la casa se encuentra en mal estado con el techo roto y además el piso quebradizo. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para recibir apoyo financiero por medio de créditos y así lograr su sueño de construir su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and to pay for labour wages

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa C. P. since she was a very young lady she has been working as a house cleaner in her own neighbourhood, the region of El Sauce in Leon. She is mother to three school-aged children and she, together with her husband, work very hard to improve the financial situation they live in.

Her greatest desire is to remodel their home because it is currently in a state of disrepair and with the fast-approaching winter season, the heavy rains would prove to be catastrophic and in that they would lose all their material possessions. To prevent this situation she has managed to secure loans with Ceprodel that she has invested solely on the pruchase of building materials to start their home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. P. desde muy jovencita se ha dedicado al trabajo de empleada domestica en su local de habitación en el municipio de El Sauce en Leon. Es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar y junto con su esposo se esfuerzan grandemente por mejorar la situación económica en la que viven.

Su mayor anhelo es la inversión en la construcción de su vivienda debido a que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y además al acercarse el invierno con las fuertes lluvias provocarían una catástrofe y pérdida de daños materiales. Para evitar esta situación ha logrado obtener créditos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido exclusivamente en la compra de parte de los materiales para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and labour for her improvements to her home.

loans.name: Rutila Avilés

texts.es:
For 25 years in the city of Leon in the region of El Sauce, Rutila Aviles has worked as a primariy school teacher, teaching kids from pre-school to grade 6 in the school w here she works.

Rutila has been working hard despite the difficult situation across the country. She has not been able to invest in the remodelling of her home, something that she had already started bus was forced to stop facing a lack of funds. She urgently needs to continue with the remodelling because her home in its current condition is unprotected and she risks becoming a victing of an adverse situation.

Ceprodel has provided her with past loans which she has invested in the purchase of buidling materials, but aside from this she needs to pay the labour associated with the work, and for this reason once a month she seeks the help of this institution to help her meet her dream of improving of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 25 años en la ciudad de León, específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce la señora Rutila Aviles se ha desempeñado como maestra de primaria atendiendo niños de preescolar a sexto grado en el colegio donde se ha desempeñado.

La señora Rutila a pesar de esforzarse grandemente en la docencia y por la difícil situación que atraviesa el país, no ha logrado invertir en la remodelación de su casa sino que inició con esta remodelación pero se detuvo y no continuo por falta de recursos económicos. Es necesario destacar que urgentemente ella necesita continuar con esta construcción ya que al estar desprotegida la casa corre el riesgo de ser victima de alguna situación adversa.

Ceprodel la ha apoyado con créditos que los ha invertido en compra de materiales pero aparte de esto necesita invertir en mano de obra y por tal razón una vez mas acude a esta institución para obtener el crédito y así lograr su meta de mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Tereza Del Rosario

texts.es:
Tereza S. is a married woman with a son in her charge. She has is known for being a hardworker with a strong desire to have a stable small business to support her family that are in such need.

It has been 10 years since Tereza S. has been running her small grocery store selling various products in the region of El Sauce in Leon. Her sales have been increasing significantly in the past years, since she expanded the business and improved the outlay, and she did so for the simple reason that it is the only income her family earns.

Tereza S. has been working with Ceprodel for two years and she feels very grateful for the loans that have been granted to her in a timely manner, helping her acquire the goods needed for her business and to satisfy the daily demand of her clientele. In her record she has had 5 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Tereza S. es una dama casada y con un hijo a su cargo, se caracteriza por ser emprendedora y con muchos deseos de tener un negocio propio estable para poder apoyar a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

Desde hace diez años Tereza S. se dedica a la venta de productos varios (pulpería) en el municipio El Sauce en León. Sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo por la sencilla razón de que este es el único ingreso de su familia.

Tereza S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de cinco créditos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Yadira Justina

texts.es:
Yadira D. has been teaching children for 10 years in a small school in the region of El Sauce in the beautiful city of Leon. She is married and has two school-aged children and a little one on the way. Yadira's efforts are all towards providing the best for her little ones and even though she is pregnant she continues to teach in the school.

Yadira's urgent need is to rebuild part os her home as it is in a state of disrepair - the walls are damaged, the floors are cracked, holes in the roof - she sees no way to stay in her home in its current condition, especially when the baby is born. Given the situation Yadira has sought out the help of Ceprodel to acquire a loan with which she will purchase bricks, cement, roof tiling, wood and to pay for the labour required to rebuild her home in time for her baby's birth.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Yadira D. es una dama que desde hace 10 años se dedica a impartir clases a niños en un pequeño colegio del municipio El sauce en la bella ciudad de León. Es madre casada con dos hijos en edad escolar y uno pronto de nacer. La señora Yadira asegura que sus esfuerzos son para brindarles lo mejor a sus pequeños y a pesar de su estado de embarazo, ella continua impartiendo clases en el colegio.

La necesidad de la señora Yadira es la urgencia de reconstruir su casa de habitación por lo que se encuentra en mal estado, las paredes dañadas, el piso quebradizo, el techo con huecos y no puede de ninguna manera estar en estas condiciones en el momento que su bebé nazca. Consiente de esta situacion la señora Yadira ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con los créditos que le permiten invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, tejas, madera y pago de la mano de obra para remodelar su hogar y prestar mejores condiciones para cuando su hijo nazca.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks, cement, roof tiling, wood, and labour wages

loans.name: Mtoni B Group

texts.en:
Shaban M., age 54, is married and has 9 children (ages 27, 23, 21, 19,16, 13, 10, 8, and 7). He owns a business in fruit sales which he started 5 years ago. He works from 4 am to 5 pm daily, and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$68.2.

In the past, Shaban has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand his business. He now hopes to receive a new loan for further business expansion. Shaban will share this loan with his sub-group members who have businesses in the sale of food, clothes, soft drinks, and mobile phone accessories.

In the picture, Shaban is the first one on the left.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mtoni A Group

texts.en:
Zubeda R., age 37, is married and has two children (ages 19 and 5). She owns a shop which she opened two years ago. Zubeda's store is open from 8 am to 8 pm daily, and allows her to make a monthly profit of around US$213.3.

In the past, Zubeda has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to receive a new loan for further business expansion. Zubeda will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in selling food, plastic scrappers, and other items.

In the picture, Zubeda is the one in the middle.

loans.use: Expansion of a shop

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia Benítez de Silva is a 45 year old mother of four children and has been married to her husband Justo for 20 years. In order to provide income for her family, Celia has worked on the street as a newspaper vendor. She works on a very important avenue in the city where she lives. In order to increase her profits, she began working with Fundación Paraguaya to buy new goods.

Now Celia is making more income selling fruits along with her newspapers. With the initial loan from the Fundación, she was able to invest in fruits and newspapers toprovide to people who walk or drive along the busy avenues where she works. The loan she is asking for today will be used to invest more money into fresh local fruits including watermelon, plums, apples and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits including bananas, apples, watermelon, and plums.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca Lila G. de Rodríguez has raised pigs her whole life. She has made it her own business now that she has her own family and is married with four children. She sells the meat that she raises to the local supermarkets and butcher shops throughout the area.

Thanks to the help of her first loan from Fundacion Parguaya she was able to expand her business and include cows. She now raises 13 cows to sell their milk and their meat. With the loan she is asking for today, Blanca will invest in buying more cattle to raise and sell. With the earnings she has gained from the milk and the meat of her cows now, she sees that there is much opportunity to expand her business and raise the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs and cows.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.en:
Calixto O. is a traveling salesman. He bakes various goodies made of corn and sells them on the streets, at soccer games, in parks and to parties. As a way to provide income for his wife and three children he is looking to expand his business and buy a cart.

With a cart, Calixto will be able to carry around more goodies, especially his most popular item, Pororó. With more to sell and a way in which to transport his goods farther, his income will rise.

loans.use: To buy a little cart to sell his baked goods.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos Antonoio Y. was born in the city of Luque. He has made his life in Luque and is now married with a daughter. Their daughter has been very successful and is in her fourth year of medical school in Asuncion.

Carlo owns a metal shop where he has created enough income to support his family. There he works in construction and repair and body work on cars. He has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya to help stimulate his income and his company’s profits. He is now asking for a loan to increase the amount of iron in his shop along with other various materials.

loans.use: To buy iron and various materials.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo B. is 38 years old and is married to Alicia Rolon.  Together they have three children, a fourteen year old daughter and two younger sons.  During the week, Carmelo works as a mechanic, and on the weekends and some nights, he works as a taxi driver.  Carmelo works a lot, but does so in order to better the life of his wife and three children. 
He has been working with  Fundacion Paraguaya for only a short amount of time, less than a year.  Carmelo is asking for a loan to buy tools for his mechanic shop and to help develop his business.  His hope is that soon his shop will bring in enough money so that he does not have to work on the weekends.

loans.use: To buy a set  of keys and a hydraulic press.

loans.name: Kenia Rafaela

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Kenia began her small business selling sweets, such as cookies, caramels, and ice cream, from the sidewalk in front of her house. This was due to the difficult economic situation in which she found herself at that time. Her husband was without a job, and it was through her business that she was able to feed and educate her 2 children. She now has a small store selling basic goods, which is the fruit of all those years of work. She offers a variety of basic products, such as basic grains, dairy products, breads and pastries, and non-perishable foods. She spends her whole day working in her business, and she is satisfied with what she has achieved. She has plans to expand the space of the business and also to offer new products, with the goal that her customers can have a better variety of products, brands, and prices. Currently, she wishes to increase the inventory of products that she has, because getting them on credit from the wholesaler is a limiting factor for her. She wants to buy in cash in order to offer her clients better service by having everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Kenia hace 8 años inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo en la acera de su humilde vivienda golosinas como galletas, caramelos y helados, esto surge debido a la difícil situación económica en la que se encontraba en ese momento, ya que su esposo había quedado sin empleo y fue de esta manera como logró alimentar y educar a sus 2 hijos. Hoy en día tiene una pulpería fruto del trabajo de todos estos años, en la cual ofrece una variedad de productos alimenticios de consumo básicos como granos básicos, lácteos, potería, perecederos, entre otros. Esta actividad le dedica todo el día, ella se encuentra satisfecha con lo que ha logrado. Ella tiene planes de expandir el espacio de su negocio y así también poder ofrecer nuevos productos, con el objetivo que sus clientas tengan una mayor variedad de productos, marcas y precios. En estos momentos la señora desea aumentar el inventario de productos que tiene, ya que adquirirlos al crédito de la casa comercial es una limitante, quiere comprar al contado para ofrecerles a sus clientas un mejor servicio en el cual puedan encontrar todo lo que necesitan.

loans.use: To buy milk, cheese, beef, chicken, vegetables, sugar, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso P. is a young father at the age of thirty two. He is happily married to his wife Teresa and together they have 2 children. He spent a lot time in Argentina as a driver and after he managed to save enough money he returned to Paraguay. When Celso returned, he opened a shop with some telephones and sold their services. He then increased his goods to include newspapers and books, and now his shop sells food merchandise, too.

Celso wants to open his own grocery store eventually. He will use this loan to continue expanding the products sold and will continue to save his earnings for a larger grocery store.

loans.use: To buy food merchandise like rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, cookies, soda, sugar, along with telephone cards.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco is 47 years old. He is married and has 4 children who are studying in high school. The gentleman is a pineapple producer with more than 30 years of experience. He works all day on the plantations and he is involved in the whole production process including post-harvest and selling them.

It is relevant to explain that the production of pineapples requires an adequate fertilizer so that they can generate the expected harvest. Nutrients and chemical fertilizers are needed throughout the process. Currently, Francisco is having difficulties getting into the market with his product due to the fact that he doesn't have enough organic matter to incoporate into the soil. There isn’t enough fertilizer and the soils are poor in nutrients. It is for these reasons that his harvests aren’t going well. He lacks the capital to be able to correctly prepare the plantations and thereby achieve a successful harvest in which he can sell his pineapples in the different markets.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco, tiene 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en secundaria, el señor es un productor de más de 30 años de experiencia dedicándose al cultivo de piña, trabaja todo el día en las plantaciones y se encuentra involucrado en todo el proceso productivo desde la postcosecha hasta la comercialización de la misma. Es relevante señalar que el proceso productivo de la piña requiere de una adecuada fertilización para que pueda generar la cosecha esperada, además de los nutrientes y abonos químicos que se necesitan en todo el proceso. Actualmente, el señor posee dificultades en la incursión del mercado con su producto, debido a que no cuenta con el material vegetativo necesario, no existe la fertilización adecuada, los suelos son pobres en nutrientes, razón por la cual sus cosechas se encuentra detenidas debido a la falta de capital económico para poder preparar correctamente las plantaciones y así lograr una cosecha exitosa, en la cual pueda comercializar en los diferentes mercados la piña.

loans.use: To buy nutrients like phosphorus, calcium, and organic matter for preparing his soil

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 50 year old married mother of two. Her children are grown; her daughter is studying tourism and her son is studying system analysis. Josefina is a tailor and has studied sewing and dressmaking in a private school. Her mother taught her how to sew and Josefina found that she enjoyed the work enough to make it her life work.

After her children finish their studies in the university, she will be able to save more money and amplify her earnings and her work. Until then, she is asking for a loan to invest in her sewing goods, so that she will be able to meet the high demand for her goods and for her services.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, sewing tools, and lace.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana lives in the community of San Caralampio, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. It is a mountainous rural area that has a cool climate that is good for producing citrus crops. The land is fertile and good for pineapple, and other conditions of area are also favorable for it production. It was 30 years ago that Juana decided to start cultivating pineapple and citrus crops, such as tangerines, oranges, and limes.

She and her husband both work the land and through the years they have been perfecting their techniques for the cultivation of these crops. Now Juana is requesting a loan to invest in maintaining her plants and trees. She needs to buy fertilizer and soil amendments to improve her harvest and also insecticides and fungicides to prevent problems with insects and fungi that could damage the plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana habita en la comunidad de San Caralampio, municipio de Ticuantepe, zona rural, montañosa que presenta clima fresco para producir cítricos, con tierras fértiles para el cultivo de piña, debido a las condiciones favorables que presenta esa zona, la señora hace 30 años decide incursionar en la producción de piña y cítricos como mandarina, naranja y limones. La señora junto a su esposo trabajan las tierras y con los años han ido perfeccionado la técnica de producción de los cultivos. En estos momentos, la señora solicita un préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de los mismos, ya que necesita comprar fertilizantes y nutrientes que favorezcan la cosecha así como insecticidas para evitar el contagio de las plagas o hongos que puedan dañar toda la cosecha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other soil amendments to improve the soil

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. is a seamstress and has worked in the area of dressmaking, clothing making and repair for many years. She works hard to support her two children ages 21 and 13, especially since she is the sole provider after she separated from her husband a few years ago.

She saved enough money from her seamstress work and has since opened a small convenience store in the neighborhood. It brings in more income than her sewing work did since it is the only convenience store in the neighborhood she lives in.

Lina knows that she must continue amplifying the sales of her shop in order to pay for her children’s education. She wants them to have the ability to choose whatever profession they want to go into, and to make enough money to have good lives. She is asking for a loan to buy various goods for her convenience store including rice, pasta, milk, coffee, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, rice, pasta, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo M. is a proud father of four children. Together he and his wife have taught their children the value of education and work. They all are in school and make money on the side working in different businesses. Lorenzo spent a long time working for a private business and after saving money opened up a small business of his own in his house. Lorenzo now runs a convenience store from his house where he sells various food items.

Recently his family’s income was used to pay for an unexpected surgery for his wife to have a gall stone removed. In order to make ends meet, Lorenzo also works as a painter. His wife is now recovering and he can continue to save the earnings from his convenience store. His plan is to continue increasing the amount and variety of goods in his convenience store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, pasta, oil, eggs, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia E. is a mother of two who lives in a very populated neighborhood in the city of Luque. She owns a small convenience store where she sells basic foods like sugar, flour, breads, drinks and yerba mate, a kind of green tea.. With the amount of goods she sells and the good number of clients, she wants to continue expanding her store and the items sold.

It has been three years since Marcia opened her grocery store and it is making enough money to support her children. She would like to see it continue to flourish and is therefore asking or a loan to invest in yerba mate, sodas, wine, bread, and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like dairy, breads, and drinks.

loans.name: Xiomara's Group

texts.en:
Xiomara G. M. is the leader of a group of six women who own and operate different businesses in the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. Xiomara has four children, three boys and a girl, all of whom attend school.

“A good education ensures a better future for poor people,” says Xiomara, as she explains the main reason why she is struggling to support her children's studies.

This entrepreneur will use her loan to buy fuel and other supplies for her husband’s business. Her husband uses his motorcycle as a taxi and offers his services to people in the surrounding areas.

The other members are:

  • Julisa S. L., who will use her loan to invest in the purchase of cloth and other materials to make pillows, cushions and bedspreads for her seamstress shop.

  • Teresa Claribel C. F., the owner and operator of a beauty salon.

  • María Magdalena F. S. and Maria Rosa B. M., who sell beauty products to women of their community.

  • María Oneyda A. U., who plans to use her loan to supply her grocery store.

NOTE: Members of this group warrant each other’s loans. If one of the members fails to repay her loan, the other members must take responsibility for it.

loans.use: To buy fuel and supplies for a motorcycle taxi business

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique owns a car he uses to work as a taxi driver. His home is in the area called Cristo Rey Ladera Oeste in La Paz. He has two children and his wife cannot work because when she gave birth to their youngest son, the doctors did not do carry out a proper procedure, leaving her handicapped. This is the second time Enrique has applied for a loan through Impro and his credit record qualifies him as a client type 1, which means he pays his loans on time.

Because his car is not in good shape and because of the requirements stipulated by the taxi company he works for, Enrique is in need of a better vehicle. He will use this loan to buy a car that complies with the requirements of his taxi company. Enrique's old car is about to be sold and the money he will receive from the sale will be put into purchasing the new car. Enrique's good credit record allows him to apply for this loan because he is an experienced driver.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Enrrique tiene una movilidad que trabaja como Radio Taxi. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Cristo Rey Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene dos hijos y su esposa no puede trabajar ya que cuando ella tuvo su ultimo hijo le realizaron una mala operación donde quedo minusválida. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. Por el mal estado de su vehiculo y las exigencias de la empresa de Radio taxis que representa se ve obligado a cambiar de vehiculo por uno mas moderno. El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de un vehiculo acorde a las exigencias de la Empresa de Radio Taxis donde él trabaja. Su actual vehiculo está en proceso de ser vendido y el dinero que recibirá por dicha venta será usado para completar el valor total del nuevo taxi. Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia A. was born and raised in the town of Luque. She is now married with three children, her oldest daughter helps with their mother’s business of selling various books and household items. Her husband, Agustin is a plumber and does other various types of construction work.

Since 2001, Nicasia has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya to better her business. She is now selling products in the city of Ciudad del Este, as well. With this loan, Nicasia will buy more products for her business including books, home products and more.

loans.use: To buy various items like books, small home items, and more.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar has a company called Alpaca Andina (Andean Alpaca) where she makes sweaters, coats, scarves and shawls, among other garments, using alpaca wool. She buys raw material (alpaca wool) from a workshop with which she has signed a contract that says the workshop will charge Pilar per finished garment. She sells the products in her store, located on Sagárnaga street in La Paz. Pilar has hired a woman to be in charge of the store's sales. Sagárnaga street is located on La Paz' main tourist area.

Pilar lives in the area called Alto Sopocachi Ladera Oeste in La Paz. This is the third time she has requested a loan through Impro; her credit record qualifies her as client type 1, meaning she pays her loans on time. Pilar will use this loan to buy raw material (alpaca wool). Her Credit record allows her to apply for this loan since she is experienced in the field of alpaca wool and most of her clients are foreigners (tourists visiting La Paz).

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Pilar tiene una empresa llamada Alpaca Andina donde elabora chompas abrigos, chalinas, chals y otros trabajos en lana de alpaca. Ella compra la materia prima (que es lana de alpaca) y tiene contrato con un taller donde le cobran por prenda terminada y ella las vende en su tienda ubicada en la calle Sagarraga de la ciudad de la Paz. En su tienda cuenta con una empleada que se encarga en la atención para la venta de su mercadería. La calle Sagárnaga está ubicada en el Sector más turístico de la ciudad de La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Sopocachi Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. El crédito será destinado para la compra de de materia prima (Lana de Alpaca) Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el trabajo con alpaca y la mayor parte de su clientela es del extranjero (turistas que visitan la ciudad de La Paz).

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Odilonia

texts.en:
Odilonia T. is separated from her husband who left her alone to support her children financially. She worked in Argentina for 15 years in order to make the capital to start her own store. Now she owns a small convenience store which is connected to her house in Luque, Paraguay.

Although she is successful as an only parent, she still struggles to pay the bills at times. This led her to work with the Fundación Paraguaya and today she is asking for a loan to help pay for an increase in and the diversification of her goods.

loans.use: To buy food items for her grocery store like rice, oil, milk, eggs, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.en:
Patrocinio E. is a 43 year old father of three school age children. He is married to his wife Zulma and together they own a small convenience store. Zulma runs the store while Patrocinio is working at a public institution close by.

Patrocinio"s hope is that they will be able to increase the business in their store and that the savings between he and his wife will be enough to send his children to the university. With this loan, Patrocinio will purchase popular items that are in constant demand in his shop.

loans.use: To buy food goods for his convenience store including oil, milk, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Ramona's Group

texts.en:
Together a large group of women has come together to support each other in their work towards increasing their incomes. They meet a few times a week to pay their loans back and discuss good business practices.

They are asking for a loan today to help their various businesses expand. Everything from food making, to clothes sales, to small grocery stores. These women are doing whatever they can in order to support their families and secure the best future for their children.

loans.use: The money will be used to amplify each woman’s business and will go towards the purchase of things like milk, sugar, eggs, meats, dairy products, breads, clothing, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
Silverio A. lives near the center of the town of Luque. He is married and has older children. Silverio works making baking goods to sell for profit and has been doing so for the past six years.

Siverio is asking for a loan in order to fully amplify his business. With access to an industrial kitchen he will be able to make many more baked goods and increase his profits. The conditions in which his small number of employees work will be bettered and profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia D. was the founder of the committee of women. She gathered both her neighbors and her friends who had their own businesses and who wanted to increase their success. Together they meet and ask for loans, discuss business plans and support each other. These women are encouraging entrepreneurship and financial stability.

They all have different businesses and therefore the loan will be used in many different ways to buy clothing to sell, merchandise for the home, and also for food to be sold in their grocery stores.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, flour, bread items, dairy, drinks, fruits, vegetables, baking goods, cleaning products, clothing and other household goods.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepcion R. is a young woman who some months ago started her own small business, a grocery store in the city of Leon, in the El Sauce region of this beautiful city.

Since she was very young she been a hardworker and today she sees the need to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store. With the help of her business, this young woman supports her elderly parents and today more than ever they depend on her

To improve her business and to continue to fill the necessities of her home, Miss Conception R. has successfully repaid 5 loans with Ceprodel which she has used to purchase supplies for her grocery store. Importantly, since she has been working with Ceprodel she has been very responsible to repay the laons she has acquired on time and as indicated.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción R. es una joven que desde hace pocos meses inicio su pequeño negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de León específicamente en el municipio El Sauce de esta bella ciudad.

Desde muy jovencita se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y hoy en día su necesidad es la de invertir en la compra de la mercadería para surtir la pulpería. Cabe señalar que por medio de este negocio, la joven mantiene a sus padres en edad avanzada que hoy mas que nunca dependen de ella.

Para mejorar la situación de su negocio y continuar supliendo las necesidades de su hogar, la dama Concepción R. ha realizado 5 créditos en Ceprodel que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos de pulpería y de esta manera ha logrado mantener a sus padres. Es necesario destacar que desde que trabaja con Ceprodel, muy responsablemente ha logrado pagar todos estos créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cresencio Ramiro

texts.es:
Cresencio C. is a hard working man who works as a security guard for a private institution in the local town of Leon, town of El Sauce. He's a father to two children who he makes an effort to give them all they need and at the same time offer them a better future.

Due to difficult economic conditions and not being able to find a job, he decided to become a security guard. This is a very dangerous job but he wishes to build his house because it is in awful conditions and nature has also destroyed some of it.

In order to fulfill this dream, Crecencio has come to Ceprodel and requested a loan that will allow him repair his house and at the same time improve his family's way of life. Cresecio has already had 4 loans through Ceprodel and with these credits, he's been able to build a concrete wall. He still needs to complete his bedroom wall.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Cresencio C. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica al trabajo de guarda de seguridad en una institución privada ubicada en la ciudad de León en el pueblo El Sauce. Es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar quien día a día lucha para brindarles un mejor futuro y un techo digno donde vivir.

Debido de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa y al no hallar empleo en ningún lugar, decide iniciar este peligroso trabajo de guarda de seguridad con el único fin de reconstruir su casa debido a que se encuentra en mal estado y además los fenómenos de la naturaleza la han dañado mucho.

Para lograr este sueño, Crecencio ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con Créditos que le permitan mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y de esta manera brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Don Cresencio actualmente ha realizado 4 créditos en Ceprodel y según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente ya que con estos créditos ha logrado levantar un muro de concreto pero aun le hace falta mucho mas para terminar de reconstruir su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Improvement of his home

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores Group

texts.en:
This large group of women entrepreneurs have come together to ask for a loan to increase their business profits. They all are neighbors, friends, and own their own businesses; everything from selling clothing to food, cleaning supplies and making and fixing clothing. The funds will be used wisely because they all depend on one another’s smart business moves.

These women depend on loans to keep their businesses running. They all have families who need money to survive and the women understand that they need to do what ever they can to keep their income rising.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for the different businesses including: bananas, watermelons, pineapples, oranges, sugars, refreshments, women’s undergarments, fabric, pants, t-shirts, and medicines.

loans.name: Ediccia Raquel

texts.es:
One of the biggest businesses no matter where we are is the selling of food because we need these in order to be able to complete our day to day chores.

In El Sauce municipality, Leon department in Nicaragua, Mrs. Edicia P. dedicates her time to sell food , coffee and refreshments. She's a single mother with two girls which she needs to support. For this reason she works very hard and hopes to fulfill all of her daughters' needs.

Although she does the role of mother and father, Mrs. Ediccia P. has been able to attend to her home needs, run her business and overlook her daughters' development and growth. For this reason, she approached Ceprodel and they have given her the credit necessary in order to acquire raw materials in order to continue to prepare foods and sustain her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Uno de los negocios mas importantes en cualquier parte donde nos encontremos es la venta de comida debido a que a diario las personas hacen uso de los alimentos para continuar la labor de cada dia.

En el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León en Nicaragua, la señora Ediccia P. se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en su localidad propia donde también vende café y refrescos. Es madre soltera y con dos niñas a quien mantener, es por tal razón que realiza un sobre esfuerzo en su trabajo para satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus pequeñas hijas.

A pesar de hacer el papel de padre y madre para sus niñas, la señora Ediccia P. se ingenia para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, atender el negocio y velar por el cuido de sus hijas. Por esta razón es que ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado para la adquisición de su materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for her business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Ramona R. de Mancuello is married and is the mother of five children. Four of her children are still students in the university and in grade school. Only her eldest is employed. She began her business selling things as a traveling vendor. When she saved enough money to invest, she opened a small grocery store out of her house. Now this is a way for her family to survive.

Ramona also has worked in the community fighting for the rights of her neighbors and friends. She has done some social work and helped insure the building of over 70 homes by the government. Today Ramona is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary goods for her store.

loans.use: To buy food merchandise to sell like rice, pasta, oil, milk, cookies, soda and sugar.

loans.name: Elí De La Cruz

texts.es:
Eli L. is a gentleman who for six years has had a home business providing grinding services, which he takes great effort to attend to every day, from very early morning hours to late afternoon.

His wife and son are the reason he works day to day, to satisfy all their needs and further to complete his role as responsible father, giving food, sound shelter and education to his young son.

It is important to note that since he began his business, he has searched for a way to acquire new grinders but due to their high cost he has been unable to obtain them. For this reason, today he requested that CEPRODEL allow him to be granted a loan which he will invest in the purchase of the grinders so that he can continue giving his family sustenance every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Eli L. es un caballero que desde hace 6 años posee un negocio propio en su hogar de habitación como lo es el servicio de molino que muy esforzadamente atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Su esposa e hijo es el motivo por el cual se preocupa día a día por satisfacer todas sus necesidades y además por cumplir su rol de padre responsable brindando alimentación, techo digno y educación a su hijo menor de edad.

Es de importancia señalar que desde que inicio su negocio ha buscado la manera de cómo adquirir nuevos molinos pero por su alto costo no lo ha logrado es por esto que hoy en día acude a CEPRODEL consiente de que será beneficiado con créditos que los invertirá en la compra de los molinos para así continuar brindándole a su familia el sustento de cada día.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
The municipality of El Sauce, León is known for being an area with very hard working residents. Such is the case of Juana, who, since a very young age, has worked as a high-quality dressmaker.

Juanita currently needs to invest in fixing up her home, which has become damaged by natural disasters. She has not been able to make the necessary repairs since her seamstress business is unstable as her clients do not need her services every day.

In order to improve her condition and invest in the reconstruction of her home, she has accepted several CEPRODEL loans. She states that they have been very helpful, and she has used them to purchase the necessary materials for fixing her humble home.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

El municipio El Sauce de León se caracteriza por ser una zona donde viven personas muy trabajadoras. Tal es el caso de la señora Juana que su actividad económica desde muy jovencita ha sido la elaboración de vestidos siendo una costurera que ha sobresalido por su alta calidad con que realiza sus trabajos.

Juanita actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su casa de habitación debido a que los fenómenos naturales la han dañado tanto y no ha logrado reparar los daños ya que el negocio de costurería es bastante inestable porque los clientes no están solicitando de su servicio todo el tiempo.

Para mejorar con esta condición e invertir en la reconstrucción de su hogar, ella ha realizado créditos en CEPRODEL y según cuenta le han sido muy útiles porque los ha utilizado para la compra de los materiales de construcción que utilizara en la construcción de su humilde vivienda.

loans.use:
Home improvements

Mejoras de vivienda

loans.name: Leonel Hermógenes

texts.es:
Being a traveling salesman is an activity that requires a lot of sacrifices, including sun exposure and fatigue from walking while hauling the goods to be sold. In spite of this, Mr Leonel R. works selling meat in the streets of his hometown El Sauce, León.

Ever since a very young age, he has been deemed a very hard worker. Since the El Sauce municipality is a livestock area, before starting his current business, he worked in agriculture and livestock, where he learned to work under any conditions, rain or shine.

Nevertheless, Mr. R. currently needs to purchase meat for its sale, and he uses the Ceprodel loans to this end. The money is used to buy meat, and this allows him to support his household.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

El negocio de venta ambulante es una actividad que requiere de mucho sacrificio por la exposición al sol y el cansancio de caminar y cargar con la mercadería que se vende. A pesar de esta situación, el señor Leonel R. se dedica a la venta de carne vendiéndola ambulantemente por las calles del municipio El sauce en León de donde es originario.

Desde muy niño se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y como el municipio El Sauce es zona ganadera, antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba a la ganadería y agricultura donde aprendió a trabajar bajo cualquier circunstancia ya sea bajo sol o bajo lluvia.

No obstante, a pesar de dedicarse a este negocio, el señor R. atraviesa la necesidad de comprar la carne para comercializarla y para esto hace uso de los créditos que le brinda Ceprodel el cual los invierte en la compra de esta carne y por medio de esta actividad lleva el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

loans.use:
Purchase of meat

Compra de carne

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria G. is a woman who, for many years, worked in a small school in León, El Sauce teaching preschool and primary level students.

As an only child, she works diligently to support her elderly parents who need her so much. One of the family’s most pressing needs is to invest in the infrastructure of their home. She began construction work in a small part of their home, but she needs to purchase more materials in order to continue the project and not leave it only half done.

Ceprodel has been helping her with loans that she directly invested in the construction of the living room, the first part of her home. However, she still has to work on the patio, bathroom and bedrooms, which she would like to finish before summer when prices are higher. Her credit record includes 3 Ceprodel loans, each of them paid back on time and under the terms agreed to by both parties.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Maria G. es una dama que por muchos años se ha dedicado a la docencia desempeñándose como maestra de niños atendiendo preescolar y primaria en un pequeño colegio en la ciudad de León en el municipio El Sauce.

Por ser hija única, se esfuerza grandemente para llevar el sustento a sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de ella. Un a de las grandes necesidades que atraviesa esta pequeña familia es la urgencia de invertir en la infraestructura de su local. Actualmente ha iniciado con la construcción en una pequeña parte de su casa pero le urge la compra de los materiales para continuar con dicha construcción y no dejar a medias la obra que ha iniciado.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que los invirtió directamente en la construcción de la primera parte de su casa como lo es la sala pero aun le hace falta el patio, baño y cuartos que pretende terminar lo mas pronto posible antes de que llegue el verano y se den lugar a grandes perdidas materiales y económicas. Actualmente su record es de 3 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use:
Purchase of construction materials

Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora S. G. sells watches in the jungle city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sets up a stand every morning across the street from the major market in the center of Tarapoto. She’s been selling watches and accessories for 8 years and now has many loyal customers.

Isidora is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. She enjoys working and helping her family. Without the money she has earned selling watches, her children would have never had the opportunity to study. Isidora is proud of her accomplishments and has gained a lot of confidence. Her business brought her independence, a voice, and self-esteem.

A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra De La Paz, Isidora is requesting a loan of $700 (s/2000) to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital, she would like to buy watches, batteries, and spare parts.

loans.use: She would like to buy watches, batteries, and spare parts

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline R. R. has a general store in Tarapotillo, San Martin.  Tarapotillo is a neighborhood outside the city of Tarapoto.  In the store she sells fruits, vegetables, rice, oil, sodas, hygiene products and much more.  Clients are happy they can buy the majority of their goods from Jaqueline instead of walking all the way into Tarapoto.  
Jaqueline is 33 years old, married, and has one young child.  She started the store 8 years ago in the living room of her home.  She has recently built a room especially for the store with shelves and display cases.  She loves being able to work from home and care for her child.  One day Jaqueline dreams of sending her child to a University.
A member of the community bank Mujeres Decididas, Jaqueline is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her shelves with the goods the population of Tarapotillo love.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her shelves with the goods

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene S. P. makes custom bed, sofa, and pillow covers in the city of La Banda de Shiclayo, San Martin.  She’s been running the business for 15 years.  She doesn’t advertise because she doesn’t need to, her clients spread the word about her quality goods.
Marlene is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She loves working from home where she can spend time with her family.  The money Marlene makes goes directly into savings for her children’s education.  Marlene feels lucky she had the opportunity to start a business and help her family.  She enjoys building relationships with clients and has gained new self confidence.  
A member of the community bank Manos Unidos, Marlene is requesting a loan of s/2000 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she will buy an industrial sewing machine.  With the new machine she will be able to significantly increase production.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Q. V. runs a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin. Jepelacio is a rural town that is a one-hour car ride from Moyobamba, the capital of San Martin. At her store, she sells basic commodities and has many loyal customers. They are happy they don’t need to travel to another city or walk across town to buy their goods.

Juana is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. She started the business three years ago because she loves to work and she wanted to help her family. She now has more friends, greater self-esteem, and feels more secure about her family’s future. She is also happy she can work from home where she can take care of her children.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Juana is requesting a loan of $350 (s/1000) to repay over 4 months. With the extra capital she would like to buy chicken, beef, and pork to sell in her store.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy chicken, beef, and pork to sell.

loans.name: Naranjatic 2 Group

texts.es:
Lucía is 33 years old and has 3 children. She supports her family by making traditional blouses and skirts, which she sells to the women in her village. Sometimes Lucía sells them to other people who in turn sell her products in tourist areas.

With this loan, Lucía hopes to increase her production and be able to distribute her income more efficiently between household expenses and raw material (threads, fabrics, dyes) purchase. The other members of this group are craftswomen.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, 3 HIJOS ES UNA MUJER QUE CONTRIBUYE CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR CON EL DINERO QUE OBTIENE DE LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS Y FALDAS TIPICAS LAS CUALES SON VENDIDAS ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SUS MISMA LOCALIDAD, EN OCACIONES DISTRIBUYE PARTE DE SU MERCANCIA CON PERSONAS QUE LA VENDEN EN LUGARES TURISTICOS, ESPERA SU CREDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y CONTAR CON UNA MEJOR DISTRIBUCION DEL DINERO ENTRE LA APORTACION ECONOMICA FAMILIAR Y LA COMPRA DE SU MATERIA PRIMA (HILOS, TELAS, TINTAS), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ARTESANAS

loans.use: Purchase materials for her crafts

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina invests all the time she can in her fields and in caring for her three children, whom she adores and for whom she works very hard. She grants us a clear indicator when we see her in her house disinfecting the seeds that will soon be carried to her fields for planting. They will yield a harvest in 6 months and will become food for her family and for other consumers. Farmers always have to be very careful with the planting since that is the first step in achieving their production goals and in increasing their income. This is why they disinfect the seeds so carefully. A big limiting factor for her is not being able to buy more seeds due to the fact that their price is very significant in the local market of her city. She needs a loan to so as not to leave unachieved her hopes for her production. You can collaborate with Ricardina just by being a participant in such a noble cause.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ricardina invierte el mayor tiempo posible a su chacra y al cuidado de sus tres hijos quienes son su adoración y por quienes trabaja arduamente. Nos otorga un claro indicador cuando la observamos trabajando en su casa desinfectando las semillas que prontamente serán llevadas a sus terrenos para comenzar la siembra los mismos que después de 6 meses darán frutos y se convertirán en alimento para su familia y sus consumidores.Siempre los agricultores tienen que ser muy cuidadosos en la siembra pues es el primer paso para lograr sus metas de producción y el aumento de sus ingresos económicos, es por ello que desinfectan minuciosamente las semillas.Una gran limitación para ella es el no poder tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de semillas puesto que su precio es muy significativo en el mercado local de su ciudad, es así que ahora necesita de un préstamo para no dejar inconcluso sus deseos de producción.Usted puede hoy colaborar con Ricardina con tan solo ser partícipe de tan noble causa

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of seeds

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a very shy woman, but also very hardworking as a farmer and as the mother of 5 young children. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and corn. What they urgently need right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops so that they can produce a product that is in line with the demands of the market. She needs your help to buy the fertilizers, which are the most expensive and most necessary inputs for the cultivation of her crops. The goal is to achieve better profits and benefits in the market. Maribel doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel es una mujer muy tímida pero muy trabajadora y luchadora en su labor como agricultora y como madre de 5 niños los cuales requieren aún de cuidados por ser pequeños.Ella y su pareja se dedican al cultivo de papa, maíz y lo que ahora les urge es comprar fertilizantes, abonos y medicinas para el cuidado de sus productos para que sus terrenos puedan otorgarles productos mejorados y acorde a la exigencia del mercado.Necesita la ayuda de todos vosotros para la compra de sus fertilizantes los cuales son los más caros y necesarios para sus productos con el propósito de obtener mayores ganancias y beneficios en el mercado.Maribel no sólo necesita de la buena tierra, requiere también de una mano amiga que la ayude.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sara Elva

texts.en:
Sara Elva V. R. runs a cockfighting business in the rural jungle town of Jepelacio, San Martin. Cockfighting is a passion for people all over Peru, including major urban areas. Sara started the business 10 years ago with her husband who has loved the sport his entire life. They hold fights every Saturday night in a coliseum they built into the back of their home. They charge an entrance fee, handle the bets, and sell food and drink while the packed house bets and cheers on their favorite competitors.

Sara is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is proud of her business and all that she has accomplished. She provides a service that is in high demand and she now has a voice in her community. She is happy that she can afford to give her children the opportunity to study and become professionals.

The secretary of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Sara is requesting a loan of $700 (s/2000) to repay over 4 months. With the loan she would like to buy a freezer to keep various goods she serves her customers. The freezer will help Sara provide a better service.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy a freezer to keep various goods she serves her customers

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria spends each day attending to her customers in her small shop and, in the company of her husband, she does farm work early in the morning on weekends. These efforts together provide for the wellbeing of her children, especially for her youngest who is only 12 years old and suffers from a tumor in her eye and had to be taken to the city (Lima) for treatment. She was accompanied by her older sister who is caring for her. In order to quickly improve their quality of life, they wish to expand their store and fill it with merchandise in order to meet the needs of their community and obtain the amount of money necessary for their daughter’s treatment, which she desperately needs at this critical moment in her life. Remember that people like Maria hope that you don’t forget them.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Maria diariamente se dedica a la atención de sus clientes en su pequeña tiendita y en compañía de su esposo desarrolla sus labores agrícolas los fines de semana por las madrugadas.Ambos esfuerzos aunados por el bienestar de sus hijos y más que nada por la más pequeña de tan solo 12 años debido a que sufre de un tumor en la vista y tuvo que ser trasladada a la ciudad de Lima para su tratamiento en compañía de su hermana mayor quien la cuida y vela por ella.Por mejorar pronto su calidad de vida desean ampliar su tienda y llenarla de mercadería para que puedan abastecer satisfactoriamente a su comunidad y conseguir la cantidad de dinero necesaria para su tratamiento que mucha falta le hace en estos momentos tan críticos de su vida. Recuerda que personas como Maria esperan por ti no lo olvides.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of products for their small shop

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Señora Beatriz is 23 years old and is a part of the communal Bank “Jesús Maria.” She is the mother of a four year old son, who has become her primary motivation and source of daily strength. Beatriz makes a living selling produce such as plantains and tomatoes. She has been in the business of selling regional produce for some time, and has a goal of increasing and improving her business so that down the road she might have her own bodega (shop). With your help, Señora Beatriz will reach her goals quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

La señora Beatriz de 23 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal “Jesús Maria”, ella es madre de un niño de 04 añitos de edad, el mismo que se ha convertido en el principal motivo y motor de su trabajo y esfuerzo diario. Ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos maduros, tomates entre otros productos de pan llevar. Se dedica a la venta de sus productos regionales desde hace tiempo, con el propósito de crecer y mejorar su negocio para más adelante tener su bodega.Con tu ayuda la señora Beatriz logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Business Improvements

loans.name: Maria Griselda
