texts.en:
Maria Griselda T. R. runs a general store from her home in the rural town of Jepelacio, San Martin. In the store, she sells basic commodities, such as rice, oil, pasta, sugar, milk, beer, and soda. Her customers are happy they don’t need to walk across town to the main market when they need a common product. She started the business 4 years ago with $100 to help improve her family’s economic situation. It has turned out to be a wise investment as her business has steadily grown.

Maria is 56 years old and married with 6 children. Her children are all grown and the profits of her business help fund her grandchildren’s educations. She is happy she started her business and personally feels much more comfortable with her family’s situation.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Maria is requesting a loan of $525 (s/1500) to repay over 4 months. With the loan, she will buy more rice, sugar, candy, milk, beer, and soda to sell in her store.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more rice, sugar, candy, milk, beer, and soda to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yabteclum 2 Group

texts.es:
María, as she is known among the women in her village, is 21 years old, single and has been a craftswoman since she was 10. She uses her income to help with household expenses and buy raw material (fabric, threads and dyes) to make traditional blouses, which she sells to nearby villages.

María would like to use this loan to buy more raw material and increase her production. Other members of this group include Elvira Gómez and María Gómez, both of which own grocery stores.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA COMO ES CONOCIDA POR LAS MUJERES DE SU LOCALIDAD CUENTA CON 21 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA ARTESANA DESDE LOS 10 AÑOS LOS INGRESOS QUE OPTIENE DE SU TRABAJO ES DESTINADO AL INGRESO DEL GASTO FAMILIAR ASI COMO A LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA (TELA, HILOS Y TINTAS) PARA LA ELABORACION DE BLUSAS TIPICAS LAS CUALES LAS DISTRIBUYE PARA SU VENTA EN OTRAS LOCALIDADES CERCANAS A SU LOCALIDAD, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INCREMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES Y AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ELVIRA G. Y MARIA G. TIENEN TIENDA DE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (Fabric, thread and dye)

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
Marilú belongs to the communal bank “Jesús María” and thanks to this bank she has made structural improvements to her home. She makes living selling fish (bocachico, maparate, ractacara among other regional varieties). In order to diversify her business, she also sells bananas. Marilú is 40 years old and is the mother of five children all of whom are students. One of her children has special needs and is of particular concern to her, requiring her time and attention. For Marilú, the most important thing she can offer her children is a good home and, of course, an education. It is for this reason that she works so hard and why she wants her business to continue to grow. In order for her business to grow, she is in need of building materials to construct a kiosk in site that is appropriate for expanding her sales of fresh and salted fish. Marilú awaits the selfless assistance of your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Marilú pertenece al banco comunal “Jesús María”, gracias a este banco ha arreglado las estructuras de su vivienda. Se dedica a la venta de pescados (bocachico, maparate, ractacara entre otras variedades propias de su región), para variar su negocio de también vende plátanos. Ella a sus 40 años de edad es madre de 05 hijos los mismos que estudian, siendo uno de ellos su principal preocupación por lo especial de su padecimiento.Para Marilu lo más importante que puede brindarles a sus hijos es una buena vivienda y desde luego educación, es por eso que trabaja arduamente ya que quiere seguir incrementando su negocio y para ello requiere materiales para construir un kiosco en un lugar apropiado para expandir la venta de sus pescados frescos y salados.Ella aguarda la ayuda desinteresada de tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Business Improvements and Construction of a Kiosk

loans.name: Isis

texts.es:
Isis has made a living selling groceries for quite some time now. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, Jonatan y Nayeli (10 and 4 years old) who are her primary motive for wanting to improve her business. She is also a reseller of regional produce (papayas, bananas, yucas, etc.). Along with her husband she leaves the house very early in the morning to purchase produce to later resell them. Isis does everything she can for her sons; her only hope is that one day they will have professional careers or at least be men of some means. Her intention is to expand her business and in time have her own Minimarket. Realizing this requires an investment that will assist her, in time, to reach her goals. With your assistance Señora Isis will see the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Isis se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, ella a sus 27 años de edad es madre de dos hijos Jonatan y Nayeli de 10 y 04 años de edad respectivamente, los mismos que son los principales motivos de progreso de su negocio. Ella también es rematista de productos regionales(papayas, plátanos, yucas, etc.), pues junto a su esposo sale muy temprano a comprar sus productos para luego revenderlos, Isis hace de todo por sus hijos y sólo espera que en un mañana sean profesionales o al menos hombres de bien.Tiene un propósito ampliar su negocio y llegar a tener más adelante su Minimarket, y con el propósito de iniciar pronto la construcción de su sueño requiere de un capital que la ayudará a concretar su objetivo en el tiempo. Con tu ayuda la señora Isis observará el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Business Improvements

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Señora Norma is 42 years old. She has three children who are the reason for her progress. She is a very active woman who during the school year sells sweets in a park near her home. When school is out, Señora Norma sells groceries. Norma and her husband Señor Edgar struggle to come out ahead and, above all, to provide an education to their beloved children. Señora Norma wants to increase the production of her business and, with time become a wholesale distributor of groceries and sweets. Because of this she also would like to purchase a vehicle so that she can get around and deliver her products to those who need them. Señora Norma awaits the selfless assistance of your kind and sincere heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma de 42 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos los cuales son la razón de su progreso, ella es una mujer muy activa pues vende durante el tiempo escolar dulces en un jardín cerca de su domicilio, y en época de vacaciones doña Norma se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Ella en compañía de su esposo el señor Edgar luchan por salir adelante, y sobre todo por brindarle educación a sus queridos hijos.La señora Norma desea incrementar los productos de su negocio y con el tiempo llegar a ser una distribuidora mayorista de abarrotes y dulces, para esto requiere también de una movilidad y quiere comprarse un mototaxi para movilizarse y llevar sus productos a quienes lo requieran. La señora Norma espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble y bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Business Improvements

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es:
Mirza is a 40 year old single mother. She has five children to whom she provides total support so that they can finish their studies successfully. She makes a living selling ice cream and the juice and nectar from local fruits (such as cocona and star fruit). In order to sell her products, Mirza has to rent a tricycle, paying s/.10.00 per day, a price that is very high for her. Nonetheless she continues to work for the benefit of her family; she tells us that nothing is impossible when someone has a desire to get ahead even when acting as both mother and father for the family. She is grateful to God for having given her wonderful and understanding children. Her intention to improve her business and ultimately rent a shop where she can show and sell her products inspires her a great deal. Her desire to start down this path is why she is reaching out to your for assistance. With your help, Señora Mirza will achieve her goals in no time at all.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Mirza, es madre soltera y tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos a los cuales les brinda el apoyo máximo para que culminen sus estudios con éxito y se dedica a la venta de helados y néctar de frutas regionales (cocona, carambola entre otros). Mirza para vender sus productos tiene que alquilar un triciclo por el cual paga s/.10.00, por día, precio que es muy elevado para su economía, sin embargo ella lucha por seguir adelante y continuar con su labor en beneficio de su familia; nos menciona que no hay nada imposible cuando se quiere salir adelante y mucho menos representando el papel de madre y padre a la vez, ella agradece a Dios por haberle dado unos hijos maravillosos y sobre todo comprensibles.El deseo de incrementar su negocio y muy posteriormente alquilar un local donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos la animan mucho y desea iniciar su camino por esa razón recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu ayuda. Con tu ayuda la señora Mirza logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita R. C. sells beef, pork, and chicken in the rural town of Caserio Shucshuyecu in the region of San Martin. She’s been running the business with her husband for many years. They now have loyal clients in many surrounding towns including Moyobamba the capital of the San Martin region.

Anita is 45 years old, happily married, and has 6 children. Three of her children are independent and the other three are studying. She is happy she’s had the opportunity to work with her family over the years. She is also happy with all the friends she has made working in such a social business.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Anita is requesting a loan of $1,050 (s/3000) to repay over 6 months. The extra capital will give her the opportunity to buy more meat to sell and provide a better service.

loans.use: The loan will give her the opportunity to buy more meat to sell and to provide better service.

loans.name: Begilia

texts.es:
Begilia is an enterprising businesswoman. Her initiative and will to work are carrying her on the road to success in her business of clothing textiles. She currently lives with her two sons and husband in the small home of her elderly parents. With great creativity she has adapted her small factory and installed 10 sewing machines. With this small factory she has been able to offer employment to 9 other workers, who with persistence and agility sew about 180 sweaters and vests every day. Doña Begilia would like to save enough to build a house and offer a proper and secure dwelling to her little sprouts, in addition to giving comfort and well-being to her workers. With this proposal in mind she has thought to acquire a large quantity of raw material (wool) to continue growing with her beautiful labor. "With your generous support this exemplary mother's plans can take shape."

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Begilia, es una mujer emprendedora y empresaria, su iniciativa y su voluntad para el trabajo la están llevando por el camino del éxito en su negocio de tejidos de prendas de vestir. Ella actualmente vive junto a sus 2 hijos y esposo en el pequeño domicilio de sus ancianos padres, con gran creatividad ha adecuado su tallercito y a instalado en el 10 máquinas de tejer, con esta pequeña fábrica ha podido ofrecer empleo a otros 9 trabajadores, quienes con su empeño y agilidad diariamente tejen alrededor de 180 chompas y chalecos.El deseo de doña Begilia es ahorrar lo suficiente para construir su casita y así ofrecerles una morada propia y segura a sus pequeños retoños, además de brindarles comodidad y bienestar a sus trabajadores, con este propósito en mente tiene pensado adquirir una gran cantidad de materia prima ( lana) para seguir creciendo ampliamente con su bella labor.“Con tu generoso aporte esta ejemplar madre podrá cristalizar sus planes”

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Over 18 years ago Mariela started her family with Darío. In the beginning things were very difficult for them, with family problems and many failures in each of the businesses that they entered. As a product of these losses, her husband became involved with alcohol, and during those difficult years Mariela was the only support of her family. She never lost hope and with the important support of her children decided to enter into the noble work of weaving clothing textiles. Initially she only was dedicated to manual weaving, but by saving they implemented their factory piece by piece. Currently they feel very proud and content for the results they have obtained, because finally life smiles on them and gives them the opportunity to progress. Mariela and her husband Darío have hopes to give a good education to her exemplary and loved children and in order to solidify their desires they plan to increase the volume of production. With this goal, they appeal to your great heart and ask for a loan. Your kind collaboration will permit this family’s dreams to become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Hace más de 18 años la señora Mariela formó su familia junto a Darío, en principio las cosas para ambos fueron muy difíciles, tuvieron problemas familiares y muchos fracasos en cada uno de los negocios en los que incursionaban, producto de éstas pérdidas decepcionado su esposo se dejaba envolver por las bebidas alcohólicas, durante esos difíciles años y por ese entonces Mariela era el único sostén de su familia. Ella nunca perdió las esperanzas y con el importante apoyo de sus hijos decidió entregarse al noble trabajo del tejido de prendas de vestir, inicialmente solo se dedicaban a tejer manualmente, pero conforme iban ahorrando fueron implementando poco a poco su taller, actualmente se sienten muy orgullosos y contentos por los resultados que van obteniendo, porque finalmente la vida les sonríe y les esta brindando la oportunidad de progresar.Mariela y su esposo Darío tienen la esperanza de brindarles estudios superiores a sus ejemplares y queridos hijos y para concretar sus deseos tienen pensado aumentar el volumen de su producción, con ese fin recurren a tu buen corazón y hacen la solicitud de un préstamo. Vuestra gentil colaboración permitirá hacer realidad los sueños de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha R. V. has a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin, where she sells basic consumer goods as well as a lot of beer. She started the store in 2005 in a space in her home. Her customers in the rural town of Jepelacio are happy they can save time purchasing their goods from Martha instead of making the long trip to the main market.

Martha is 36 years old, has two children, and is single because her husband abandoned her for another woman many years ago. Now she fights to raise her two children alone and give them more opportunities than she had. The business has given her the opportunity to take charge of her life. She loves building relationships and giving customers the best possible care.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Martha is requesting a loan of $875 (s/2500) to repay over 6 months. With the loan, she would like to restock her shelves with goods and beer. In the future, she would like to be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to restock her shelves and buy beer to sell in her store

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
The art of weaving is in the items of Alejandrina, who dedicates herself every day to making delicate and beautiful decorative jackets and scarves. Thanks to these woolen items that she makes and sells in large quantities she has been able to provide for the education and well-being of her children, who are now grown up and have their own families. After her children were out of school and on their own, she decided to separate from her husband, and since then she has lived alone. Her only distraction is her beautiful and noble craft. Her goal is to purchase a wider variety of colored wools to continue producing her decorative items in large quantities. Alejandrina is very thankful for the opportunity to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El arte de tejer se materializa finamente en las prendas de doña Alejandrina, quien todos los días con mucha constancia se dedica a elaborar finas y hermosas chompas, chalecos y chalinas, gracias a estos tejidos que realiza y vende en grandes cantidades ha podido ofrecerles educación y bienestar a sus retoños, quienes ahora ya son independientes y han conformado sus propias familias.Luego de educar y ofrecerles seguridad a sus hijos en mutuo acuerdo, ella decidió separarse de su esposo. Desde entonces vive sola y la única distracción que tiene es su bello y noble trabajo de tejidos de prendas de vestir, su deseo es comprar mayor variedad de coloridas lanas para seguir produciendo gran cantidad de chompas y chalecos.Doña Alejandrina agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de incrementar las divisas de su fuente de ingreso.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities and varieties of wool / Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de lanas.

loans.name: Yabteclum 6 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 48 years old and bears a great responsibility: she has 12 children. For the past 10 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables; she used to take her products with her and offer them in different areas, but because of her age and tiredness, Maria has decided to set up a small business at her home. Some of her fruits and vegetables are grown in the region, while the rest comes from the nearest village.

Maria uses her income to buy more produce and to support her children. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to expand her business a little bit more and earn more income. The other members of this group are Maria Pérez and Juana Pérez, both of which own grocery store, and Catarina Pérez, who sells fruits.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CUENTA CON 48 AÑOS, ES UNA MUJER QUE TIENE UNA GRAN RESPONSABILIDAD YA QUE ES MADRE DE 12 HIJOS , DESDE HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 10 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, ANTERIORMENTE LO HACIA DE FORMA AMBULANTE, PERO DEBIDO A SU EDAD Y AL CANSANCIO DECIDIO ESTABLECERSE EN SU CASA, ALGUNOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS QUE VENDE SON COSECHADOS EN LA REGION Y OTRAS LAS COMPRA EN LA LOCALIDAD MAS CERCANA, SUS GANANCIAS SERA DISTRIBUIDA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y A LA MANTENCION DE SUS HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO ESPERA PODER AGRANDAR UN POCO SU NEGOCIO Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON MARIA PÉREZ Y JUANA PÉREZ QUIENES TIENEN TIENDA DE ABARROTES, CATARINA PÉREZ SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS.

loans.use: Purchase more products

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 36 years old and a beloved daughter and aunt within her family. Like her siblings and parents she is dedicated to the beautiful art of weaving chompas, decorative jackets made from alpaca. They also weave decorative headwear. From very early in the morning, everyone in her family works to combine their immense variety of wools and threads to make their beautiful decorative items, which they then collect to distribute wholesale in the city of Desaguadero. This responsible woman takes care of her parents and provides for her little nephews, who fill her life with joy and happiness. Doris' goal is to acquire more wool so she can continue creating her crafts and be able to export them quickly in large volumes. Doris waits for your help to add new life to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doris de 36 años de edad, es una hija y tía muy querida dentro de su familia, ella al igual que sus hermanos y padres están dedicados al bello trabajo de tejido de chompas. Chullos y chalecos; toda su familia desde muy temprano empieza a combinar la inmensa variedad de lanas e hilos que existe para proceder a tejer sus hermosas prendas de vestir, luego de reunir una muy buena cantidad de prendas se dedica a distribuirlas al por mayor en la ciudad de Desaguadero.Esta responsable dama tiene a su cargo el cuidado de sus ancianos y queridos padres y el apoyo económico a sus pequeños sobrinos, quienes con su alegría y travesuras van llenando su vida de dicha y felicidad, dándole mayor sentido.El deseo de Doris es adquirir materia prima (lana) para seguir elaborando creativamente sus prendas de vestir y así llegar a exportarlos en corto tiempo en grandes volúmenes. Doris espera por tu ayuda para darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of wool

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Mrs. Maruja, is a very cheerful and popular business woman in the market "Baratillo", in the city of Cusco, although she is from Juliaca. For 7 years now , she has been in the business of selling used shoes. When she began her business she was only involved in fixing them with the help of her husband, Octavio, who in his days off serves as a master builder (bricklayer). Despite the commitment to their work, the money they brought in was not enough for the needs and expenses of their six dear children. And, it is for this reason that these parents decided to venture into the business of buying and selling used shoes. At first, the business did not appear to be very profitable, but little by little with great determination and hardwork, they have the satisfaction of providing education and support to their family. This couple's wish is to increase the size of their business. Please let your heart answer the plea for this loan. Mrs. Maruja awaits your response with joy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maruja, es una mujer muy alegre y popular dentro del mercado “Baratillo” de la ciudad de Cusco, ella es natural de Juliaca pero su negocio se desarrolla en esa visitada ciudad.Desde hace 7 años está dedicada a la comercialización de zapatillas usadas, en un inicio sólo se dedicaba a arreglarlos con apoyo de su esposo, Octavio, quien en sus días libres se desempeña como maestro de obras ( albañil), a pesar del empeño con el que desenvolvían el dinero que obtenían no era suficiente para los gastos que demandaban sus seis queridos hijos.Es por ese motivo que estos ejemplares padres decidieron incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de zapatillas usadas, en principio este negocio no parecía ser muy rentable pero poco a poco con mucha voluntad fueron sacando adelante este proyecto, actualmente tienen la satisfacción de brindarles educación y tranquilidad a los miembros de su hogar.El deseo de esta pareja es aumentar el monto de capital de su negocio, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón haciéndote la petición de un préstamo. Doña Maruja espera con alegría tu respuesta.

loans.use: Additional capital in order increase their shoe inventory and grow their business. (Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de zapatillas.)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana has always been a woman of business. Her initiative, her friendliness and willingness to work makes a success of everything she does. Thanks to her way of living, she has been able to give her young children an education and security, and they depend on Ana's business of selling shoes. This loving mother is from the city of Juliaca. She buys her inventory of shoes at the market of San Jose (in her city) and sells them in the city of Cuzco. Ana now wishes to assist her oldest son, Juan, in opening up his own shoe workshop - he is talented and can manufacture his own shoes. This hardworking and responsible mother will be able to help with her beloved son's dream by taking on this loan. She is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Your support will bring this dedicated mother's dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana siempre fue una mujer D. negocios, su iniciativa, carácter amigable y su predisposición para el trabajo hacen que todas las actividades que se desempeña tengan buen término, gracias a eso le brinda educación y seguridad a sus dos menores y queridos hijos, quienes a su corta edad la apoyan en su negocio D. compra y venta D. zapatos.Esta cariñosa madre es natural D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, adquiere sus calzados en el mercado San José D. su ciudad y los oferta al por mayor y menor en la ciudad D. Cuzco, el deseo D. doña Ana es contribuir con la implementación del taller D. calzados D. su hijo mayor Juan, quien viene incursionando en la fabricación D. zapatos, con el esfuerzo que viene realizado esta trabajadora y responsable madre podrá contribuir con el sueño D. su querido hijo.Para concretar su proyecto Ana solicita un préstamo D. dinero que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso D. 6 meses. Vuestra ayuda permitirá concretar los deseos D. esta empeñosa madre.

loans.use: To help her son, Juan, install his own shoe workshop. (Implementación del taller de calzados de Juan.)

loans.name: Yabteclum 9 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 38 years old and for the past 5 years, she has been taking a wheelbarrow full of fruits and vegetables to sell them on the streets of her community every morning. She has 10 children, so all her income goes to buying more products to sell and to pay for household expenses.

With this loan, Maria wishes to improve her little itinerant business and gain more income to support her family. The other members of the group are Marcela Pérez, a craftswoman, and Veronica Pérez, a business woman who sells children and women's clothes.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CUENTA CON 38 AÑOS, DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS TODAS LAS MAÑANAS ACOMPAÑADA DE UNA CARRETILLA SALE A VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS POR LAS CALLES DE SU COMUNIDAD, TIENE 10 HIJOS POR LO CUAL SU GANANCIA LA DISTRIBUYE ENTRE LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y EL INGRESO FAMILIAR, CON EL CREDITO DESEA INCREMENTAR SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO AMBULANTE Y OPTENER MAS GANANCIAS PARA AUMENTAR SU INGRESO FAMILIAR, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO MARCELA PÉREZ ES ARTESANA Y VERONICA PÉREZ ES COMERCIANTE DE ROPA PARA NIÑOS Y DAMAS.

loans.use: Purchase of more products

loans.name: Lenith

texts.es:
Getting up early to prepare papaya juice, apple juice and other mixed juices, is the daily routine of Lenith, a lady who every morning sells her delicious nectars accompanied by a roll with ham or egg. Lenith is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 children, who are still in elementary school. Her husband, Julio, is self-employed as a mototaxi driver. They were always together in their goal of contributing to the progress of their children and are very proud of them. This is why Lenith has the desire to drive her business to the next level, and eventually build a place where she can sell her juices. She also wants to repair her husband's mototaxi since he's been struggling with different mechanical problems each day. With your help this mother will achieve her goals within a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Levantarse temprano y preparar los jugos de papaya, manzana, mixtos entre otros, es la rutina diaria de la señora Lenith, quien vende todas las mañanas sus deliciosos néctares acompañados de un pan con jamón o huevo. Lenith tiene 40 años de edad y es madre de 03 hijos aún etapa escolar, su esposo el señor, Julio, quien es trabajador independiente(chofer de mototaxi) siempre la apoya en todo, y ambos se trazaron una meta, contribuir con el progreso de sus hijos y sentirse orgullosos de ellos.Así mismo Lenith, tienen deseos de implementar su negocio y con el tiempo construir un local adecuado para la venta de los mismos, también quiere reparar el mototaxi de su esposo ya que a diario tiene muchas dificultades que impiden su normal desenvolvimiento.Con tu ayuda esta madre logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To build a small place where she can run her juice business and repair her beloved husband's mototaxi. (Implementación de su pequeño centro de producción de jugos y reparación de la herramienta de trabajo de su querido esposo.)

loans.name: Harry

texts.es:
Harry, 25 years young and single, is a hard working, enterprising individual. He makes a living transporting passengers. He's been doing this ever since he was young and now owns his own three-wheel motorcar. With this job, he's been able to contribute to the progress and well-being of his family. For him, everything is possible and in his free time, he helps his mother with her food-selling business. He needs a loan to fix up his motorcar and buy spare parts, so he can work without interruption. With your help, we can achieve the purpose of this active, young man in no time. He will not fail you.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva volunteer.

Harry, joven de 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero es muy emprendedor y empeñoso, actualmente se dedica al transporte de pasajeros.Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a esta actividad, ahora es propietario de un motocarro el cual Le ha brindado la posibilidad de aportar con el progreso y bienestar de su familia.Para él no existe nada imposible por lo que en sus ratos libres ayuda a su mamá en su negocio de venta de comidas. Ahora él necesita un préstamo para comprar los repuestos que demandan el arreglo de su motocarro, a fin de trabajar tranquilo sin interrupciones. Con tu apoyo haremos cumplir el propósito de este joven activo en corto tiempo, él no te defraudará.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his Motortaxi.

loans.name: Darling

texts.es:
Darling learned farming from her husband who worked in the fields at a very young age. They live in Ticuantepe, an agricultural area with a high potential for eco tourism. For the last 30 years, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to growing the most predominant crop in the area, pineapple, as well as, bananas, oranges, lemons and mandarins (citrus). The municipality has excellent farming conditions because of the climate and arable land, both favourable for agriculture. This is how these parents prepared their children, who are university students preparing themselves for a better life.

She explains that the production process of different crops includes chemical control of bushes, as the crops need to be free of them to develop properly; to this end, 3 cycles of chemical control -- herbicides and man power -- are needed during this process. Unfortunately, this process is expensive and Darling can't afford it at the moment. She needs a loan to cover the costs, as the success of her crops depend on it.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Darling aprendió de su esposo el oficio de la agricultura, quien desde muy joven ha trabajado en el campo, habitan en Ticuantepe una zona altamente productiva con un alto potencial para el ecoturismo. Hace 30 años la señora junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de piña siendo este el más predominante de la zona, así como banano, naranjas, limones y mandarinas (cítricos), debido a la excelente condiciones agro climática y la fertilización de las tierras que presenta dicho municipio, las cuales son favorables para la actividad agrícola. Es de esta manera como estos padres han preparado a sus 2 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, preparándose para un mejor futuro.

La señora explica que el proceso productivo de los diferentes cultivos requieren de un control químico para la malezas de las plantaciones durante el desarrollo vegetativo, ya que requieren estar libre de malezas; para ello se debe realizar por lo menos tres controles químicos a lo largo de todo el proceso, a base de herbicidas combinadas con controles manuales y esto tiene un alto costo que ella no puede cubrir en estos momentos, es por eso que necesita un préstamo para poder cubrir esos gastos, ya que de esto depende el éxito de su cosecha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her crops.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Juan lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, area of Masay, a rural community where the main economic activity that the inhabitants dedicate themselves to is citrus agriculture and vegetables. Mr. Juan has worked on his lands that he bought for forty years, on them he grows pineapples of the “Monte Lirio” variety. He is married and his wife dedicates herself to housekeeping, their children are now older and live independently of their parents. He possesses a lot of experience in managing the lands, maintaining, producing and marketing his product. The care and upkeep of these lands costs a lot, in the first months of the year he needs to prepare the earth so that it can produce a good harvest in the months of May and July, a time when it produces a better quantity depending on the climate during those months, because of that he needs to buy organic fertilizers to protect his crop from plagues and insecticides that could harm his harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, departamento de Masaya, comunidad rural en donde la actividad económica a la que se dedican los pobladores es la agricultura de productos cítricos y hortalizas. Hace 40 años, don Juan trabaja unas tierras que compro en la cual tiene sembradas varias manzanas de piña de variedad “Monte Lirio”. El señor se encuentra casado y su esposa se dedica al quehacer de la casa, los hijos que procrearon ya son mayor de edad y viven de manera independiente de sus padres. El señor posee una vasta experiencia en el manejo de la tierra, mantenimiento, producción y comercialización de este producto. El cuido y mantenimiento de estas tierras tienen costos muy alto, en los primeros meses del año se debe de preparar la tierra para que pueda dar su debida cosecha en los meses de mayo a julio, época en donde se produce en mayor cantidad debido al clima que presenta esos meses, es por eso que el señor requiere de comprar los abonos orgánicos para proteger su cultivo de plagas e insecticidas que puedan dañar su cosecha.

loans.use: To purchase liquid and solid humic acid to fertilize

loans.name: I Komang Sujana

texts.id:
I Kmonag Sujana, 52, lives in a village whose population is mostly farmers. Some are rice farmers and some others are plantation workers. In this area, plantations and rice fields can co-exist due to good irrigation. As a farmer, I Komang Sujana knows farmers needs best. The farmers in his village are having hard time obtaining fertilizer, not only due to the high price, but also due to the far location of the nearest fertilizer dealer.

Realizing this situation, he wanted to help fellow farmers and create new job opportunity by trading fertilizer. With his saving, I Komang Sujana purchased fertilizer in the nearest city which is quite far from his home. The farmers are grateful to I Komang Sujana as he made it easier for them to obtain fertilizer. One of the benefit of buying from I Komang Sujana is that he allowed the farmers to pay for the fertilizer post-harvest, to make it easier for them to afford the fertilizer

I Komang Sujana managed to build a big client base, so he needed more capital for his business. Currently he needs additional capital of $550 to purchase more fertilizer and insectisides. This business has been helping surrounding farmers tremendously and I Komang Sujana's finances are also improving significantly.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Komang Sujana, 52 tahun, tinggal di daerah pedesaan yang hampir sebagian penduduknya berprofesi sebagai petani. Sebagian berprofesi sebagi petani padi dan sebagian lagi sebagi petani perkebunan. Di daerah ini, perkebunan dan persawahan bisa berjalan dengan baik karena didukung oleh sistem pengairan yang baik. Sebagai seorang petani, I Komang Sujana memahami keperluan petani setiap saat. Petani di daerah ini mengalami kesulitan untuk memperoleh pupuk untuk tanaman mereka, karena selain harganya mahal, jarak yang ditempuh untuk memperoleh pupuk sangat jauh. I Komang Sujana menyadari kondisi ini dan ia ingin membantu para petani sekaligus sebagai lapangan usaha dengan menjual pupuk. Dengan tabungan yang dimilikinya, I Komang Sujana membeli pupuk di kota yang cukup jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Para petani merasa sangat terbantu dengan usaha yang ditekuni I Komang Sujana karena mereka tidak kesusahan lagi untuk memperoleh pupuk. Satu hal yang menjadi kelebihan usaha I Komang Sujana adalah ia menjual pupuknya dengan sistem Bayar Setelah Panen sehingga tidak memberatkan para petani. Karena mempunyai banyak pelanggan, I Komang Sujana kekurangan modal untuk usahanya. Saat ini ia memerlukan tambahan modal sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pupuk dan juga obat – obatan untuk hama tanaman. Dengan usaha ini, para petani merasa sangat terbantu dan I Komang Sujana pun merasa terbantu perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insectisides

loans.name: I Komang Dera

texts.id:
I Knomang Dera, 47 year old owns rice shell (side product of rice milling) trading business which he has been working on for the past 2 years. He picked this business since he is determined to improve his family's financial situation and to afford higher education for his children. In his village, most of the women own pig farms. One of the most popular pig feed is rice shell. Seeing an opportunity, I Komang Dera took the risk to start rice shell trading business at his home. With his saving, I Komang Dera purchased rice shell from rice mills and resell it to women in his village.

Because of his competitive pricing and good uality, I Komang Dera can sell 1 ton of rice shell per week with purchase price of 16 cents per kilogram and resale price of 17 cents. So each week he managed to get $10 profit. All of the earnings are used to fulfill his family's daily needs and saved for his children's future higher education tuition needs

I Komang Dera wants to improve his business. He needs loan to purchase more rice shell to improve his earnings. I Komang Dera is very diligent in his business because of his view that all he does will benefit his family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Komang Dera, 47 tahun, mempunyai usaha jual beli dedak padi. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni sejak 2 tahun lalu. Pekerjaan ini diambilnya karena ia ingin meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya sehingga ia akan mampu membiayai pendidikan anaknya setinggi mungkin. Tinggal di lingkungan pedesaan, sebagian besar kaum wanitanya mempunyai usaha beternak babi. Salah satu pakan yang sangat dibutuhkan adalah dedak padi. Melihat peluang ini, I Komang Dera memberanikan diri untuk membuka usaha jual beli dedak padi dirumahnya. Dengan modal tabungannya, I Komang Dera membeli dedak padi di penggilingan padi dan menjualnya kembali ke ibu – ibu di desanya. Karena harga yang bersaing dan kwalitas dedak yang baik, I Komang Dera mampu menjual dedak padi sebanyak 1 tons per minggu dengan harga beli per kilogramnya adalah Rp. 1.500.- dan dijual kembali dengan harga Rp. 1.600.- Jadi dalam seminggu ia bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 100.000.- Semua keuntungan itu ia pergunakan untuk kebutuhan keluarganya sehari – hari dan juga ditabung untuk persiapan biaya pendidikan anaknya. I Komang Dera ingin meningkatkan usaha agar lebih maju lagi. Ia memerlukan pinjaman dana untuk dapat membeli lebih banyak lagi dedak padi sehingga ia bisa meningkatkan keuntungannya. I Komang Dera sangat tekin dalam usahanya karena ia mempunyai prinsip bahwa semua yang dilakukannya sekarang adalah untuk keluarganya.

loans.use: Rice shell trading

loans.name: I Made Mekir

texts.id:
I Made Mekir has planted 300 Vanilla trees in his 15 acre land since 3 years ago. It has produced one harvest, despite not too much. Last harvest, I Made Mekir produced 150kg vanilla for $4 per kg. However, vanilla trade is promising for its high price and low maintenance requirement. In one 12 month harvest cycle, a Vanilla tree requires compost fertilizer and insecticide and herbicide spray once every 3 months. In June to September, the vanilla trees starts blooming, and at this time I Made Mekir is busy to pollinate he flower to produce fruit. Vanilla does not produce without human intervention. Currently, I Made Mekir needs additional capital to pay for a contract labor to help pollenize. The pollination has to be done in one day window and the flower will wither if not pollinated on time. Lately, fertilizer and insecticide price is increasing, which makes life harder. With the loan, I Made Mekir hopes to improve his farming process to improve yield.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Di areal tanah seluas 15 are milik I Made Mekir, tumbuh dengan subur tanaman Vanili sekitar 300 pohon. Tanaman Vanili ini telah di tanam oleh I Made Mekir sejak 3 tahun yang lalu dan sudah dapat sekali panen walau hasil panennya tidak terlalu banyak. Panen yang lalu I Made Mekir mendapat Vanili sebanyak 150 Kg dan harga per kilogramnya Rp. 35.000.- / kg. Namun begitu, tanaman ini sangat menjanjikan. Di samping karena harganya yang sangat mahal, pemeliharaanya tidak terlalu sulit. Dalam satu periode panen yaitu selama 12 bulan, tanaman Vanili membutuhkan perawatan berupa pupuk yaitu pupuk kandang dan semprotan anti hama / jamur yang biasanya di lakukan setiap 3 bulan sekali. Pada bulan Juni sampai September, tanaman Vanili ini mulai berbunga dan saat itu pula I Made Mekir mulai sibuk untuk mengawinkan bunga Vanilinya agar bisa menghasilkan buah, karena tanpa bantuan manusia tanaman ini tidak dapat berproduksi . Pada masa ini pula I Made Mekir banyak membutuhkan modal untuk membayar tenaga kerja yang membantu proses perkawinan itu karena proses ini harus dilakukan dalam satu hari saja dan bunga akan gugur bila terlambat dalam mengawinkan Belakangan ini harga pupuk dan anti hama mengalami peningkatan sehingga dampaknya sangat dirasakan oleh petani. Begitu juga dengan I Made Mekir . Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Made Mekir berharap bisa memelihara Vanilinya lebih baik lagi dan menghasilkan buah lebih banyak .

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer and Insecticide and Hire Contract Labor

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: I Made Weneh

texts.id:
Planting and fertilizing can’t necessarily guarantee good crops. Sometimes, there are other factors that influence crops significantly, such as the choice of seeds and pesticides. This is what I Made Weneh experienced as a vanilla bean farmer in Nusasari, West Bali. Because of his lack of knowledge about good vanilla bean seeds and pesticides, he didn’t get maximum results. From DINARI Foundation, I Made Weneh received training about how to grow vanilla beans well. After this training, he wanted to change his farming method, and will focus on his efforts more seriously. For this, I Made Weneh needs additional fund to buy better quality of seeds and pesticides that will prevent diseases on his plants.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Menanam dan memupuk belum cukup menjamin hasil yang akan di dapatkan akan menjadi baik . Terkadang ada faktor lain yang sangat berpengaruh pada hasil produksi para petani seperti bibit dan hama . Demikian juga halnya yang di alami oleh I Made Weneh, seorang petani Vanili yang tinggal di desa Nusasari, Bali Barat. Karena kurangnya pengetahuan tentang bibit Vanili yang baik dan tentang hama pada Vanili, seringkali petani tidak mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal. I Made Weneh mendapat pelatihan dari Yayasan Dinari tentang tata cara merawat tanaman Vanili secara baik dan benar. Setelah mendapat pelatihan itu, I Made Weneh ingin mengubah caranya bertani tanaman Vanili. Hal itu dilakukannya karena ia ingin menekuni usaha ini dengan lebih serius. Saat ini I Made Weneh memerlukan tambahan dana untuk membeli bibit Vanili dengan kwalitas yang lebih baik dan obat – obatan untuk mencegah timbulnya penyakit pada tanaman Vanili.

loans.use: To buy vanilla bean seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Huk

texts.en: Mrs. Huk Sophal, 30, is a grilled beef seller in the evening and sells noodles in the morning at Beong Salang commune, making on average US$ 6.50 in profit a day. Her husband, Eng Meng Heng, 39, is a pharmacist earning around $3.50 a day. The couple hopes to use this loan to expand their business by purchasing more beef and selling in larger quantities. The rest of money they will use to renovate their house.

loans.use: purchasing more beef and selling in larger quantities

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon S., 37, works as a housewife staying at home looking after the children and cooking food for her entire family. To support their daily expenses, her husband Mr. Puong Chorven, 49, works as taxi-driver making on average $12 a day in profit.

This couple has 5 children. One of the children works as a construction laborer earning around $2.50 a day and another one works as a garment worker, making around $2 a day in profit. The other three children are students.

The couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for their daughters to use to go to work. They will use the rest of the money to fix their car.

In the future, Mr. Chorven plans to open another business (a grocery stand for his wife) to generate more profit for the family.

loans.use: purchase a motor-bike for their daughters to use to go to work and fix their car

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng N.,40, works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area and makes on average about $5 each day in revenue. Her husband works driving a motor-taxi (a trailer attached to a motor-bike to transport passengers) and earns about $6 each day in income.

This couple doesn’t have any children. They expect to use this loan to expand their grocery inventory by adding more products to meet their customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun N., 42, is a widow and works as a chef in a restaurant in Phnom Penh city. Normally she earns from her work about $2.50 a day. She has 7 children, two of whom are living away from her home.

Mrs. Bun wants to create another business for her son by purchasing a motor-taxi for him. To buy this motor-taxi she needs around $700. So now she is requesting a loan from Kiva of $700 to run a business for her son. ( Mrs. BUN posed for this picture with her mum.)

loans.use: purchase a motor-bike for her son to run a business as a motor-taxi driver

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N., 42, is a widow and works as a chief in one restaurant in Phnom Penh city. Normally she earns from her work about $2.5 a day. She has 7 children and two of who are live away from home. Mrs. Bun wants to create anther business for her son by purchasing a motor-taxi for him. To buy this motor she needs money around $700. So now she is requesting some loan from Kiva about $700 to run a business for her son. ( Mrs. BUN took pic with her mum)

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for her son to run a business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Mrs. Sren K. L., 29, with her husband Mr. Sary, 33, are door-to-door sales people selling spoons, plates, chopsticks and so on, typically making on average about $9 in profit a day. They have two children to look after. To expand this business, both are requesting a loan to purchase more plates to sell from door to door. Having a loan is great because it gives them a better life and they can send their child to university in the future.

loans.use: purchase more plates to sell from door to door

loans.name: Ong

texts.en:
Mrs. Ong S., 59, works as a housewife and cooking food for her husband. Her husband Mr. Hark, 72, is farmer and every day he has to go to his field to look after the rice. Generally he makes around $1 a day. They have two children and both are married already. The elder brother is a Khmer teacher in his village and other one works as English teacher, with a salary of about $100 each a month.

After much discussion, one son wants to run part-time English lessons for young people in his village. Unfortunately, they face a financial crisis: how to purchase classroom furniture such as tables, chairs, a blackboard and so on. So now Mr. Hark's family is requesting a loan from Kiva to run a part-time English class for young people in his area.

loans.use: purchase classroom furniture to use to run a part-time English class for young people

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sath H., 32, is married with one daughter and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her children. To generate an income, she has to go to her farm and normally she generates $1 a day in profit. Her husband Mr. Lun Vandy, 36, works as a government official making on average around $2 a day.

Mr. Lun, however, wants to borrow some money to open another business. He plans to breed pigs and resell them for profit. To make the business run successfully, Mr. Lun is requesting a loan from Kiva of $500. If that business produces more money, he will send his daughter to university.

loans.use: purchase pigs to breed to make more profit

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin R., 29, is a vendor of grocery products making on average about $1.50 a day in profit. Her husband Mr. Houn Pov, is a motor-taxi driver in Phsar Kompong Cham, and every day he earns around $2.50. This is not enough for this couple to survive since they also have two children, so they want to reinforce their business in order to provide a good family life.

Mrs. Rin plans to make her business more profitable. To make the business more profitable and provide better living conditions, they are asking for a loan from Kiva of $500. This money will be used to purchase more groceries for re-sale and also to help Mr. Houn to buy another motorbike to resell for a profit. Anything can change when they have enough capital to strengthen their business.

loans.use: purchase more groceries and a motor-bike to resell for a profit

loans.name: Fuad

texts.ru:
Mr. K. was born and still lives in the village by the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is 34 years old and married. Four years ago he began renting a workshop where he repairs automobile tires. Since Mr. K. deals with constantly changing technology, he has to update his tools and equipment from time to time and purchase spare parts. With this purpose in mind he has turned to Kiva's partner Normicrowith a request for a 500 dollar loan.

Translated from Russian, by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Г-н Fuad родился и живёт в деревне около г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 34, он женат. 4 года назад он арендовал помещение и начал восстанавливать колеса автомобилей. Т.к. Fuad имеет дело с постоянно развивающейся техникой, он вынужден время от времени обновлять свои инструменты, оборудование и прикупать необходимые для работы запасные части. С этой целью он обратился с заявлением о предоставлении ему кредита под бизнес с суммой в 500 долларов в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: To renovate the shop

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Eb Savy, 18, works as a housewife staying at home and cooking food for her husband. Her husband Mr. Sen P., 21, is a motor-taxi driver who makes on average $5 a day. To make more profit Mr. Sen wants to buy a trailer so he can transport not only people but also heavy goods. To achieve this, he needs a loan from Kiva of US$ 400 to purchase the trailer.

loans.use: purchase a trailer for his motor-taxi

loans.name: Ilkhama

texts.en:
Ms. Ilhama is a very low-income woman. She is36, single, and lives with her parents in the Sabirabad town of Azerbaijan republic in Caucasus region.

Ilhama owns and operates a bakery. She has been running this business since 2006 to support her old parents and for her own living. But income from her business is too low because the shop is in an unattractive condition, and needs to be repaired. This winter, Ilhama applied for a $700 loan with Norwegian Microcredit - KIVA partner.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun S., 27, is a housewife who stays at home and looks after the children. Her husband Mr. Chut Chung, 34, is a motor-taxi driver, making on average about $5 a day. As now their house is very old,  this couple is requesting a loan of $700 to renovate their house. (Mrs. SOEUN posed for the photo with her elder sister; she on the left-hand side.)

loans.use: renovate their house as now their house is in ill-repair

loans.name: Nakhayat

texts.en: Nakhayat is 29 years old. She is a local resident of Saatli town. She is single and lives with her people. She breeds cattle with her brother (he is shown in the picture). They have been engaged in this business for 13 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $700.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Zuwa

texts.en: Zuwa is a single woman, who has a timber business. She would like a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: D. Mukaddas was born in 1977 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. D. makes and sells the national bread known as “lepeshky”. Making “lepeshky” is a very labor-intensive work, so her sisters help her with the business. Mrs. D. is requesting a loan of 4100 TJS ($1,200USD) to open a new trade outlet for making and selling “lepeshky”.

loans.use: Open a new trade outlet

loans.name: Haraf

texts.en:
Haraf G. H. lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 children. He has had a retail shop for the last four years. Mr. G. H. has been selling groceries and he has a good number of customers.

He is planning to take an individual loan to increase his inventory and expand his business so as to make a good monthly income to help his family and to be able to pay back the loan. He is happy.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Karomathon

texts.en: A. Karomathon is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Mrs. A. lives in Khujand and sells sugar at the food bazaar. She started off selling small wares, but in time was able to rent a trade outlet in the food bazaar where she now sells sugar thanks to business development loans from MicroInvest. Now she is applying for a new loan of 1000 TJS ($300USD) that will allow her to widen her current assortment and thereby increase her business income.

loans.use: Widen existing assortment and increase business income.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 36231

loans.name: Ni Putu Arniati

texts.id:
Ni Putu Arniati’s husband, I Wayan Narka, is a farmer who works on his father’s land. Struggling to make ends meet, Ni Putu Arniati started to breed pigs. Unfortunately, the few number of pigs and the obsolete breeding methods that she used didn’t yield maximum results. To solve this, Ni Putu Arniati seek help from DINARI, which provides her with training and loans. With the loan, she will buy piglets and pig food. Ni Putu Arniati is optimistic that this time her pig breeding effort will yield profits that can help her family financially.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Arniati adalah istri dari I Wayan Narka yang berprofesi sebagai seorang Petani. Bertani mengolah kebun milik orang tuanya telah ia lakukan, akan tetapi hasilnya masih jauh dari harapan. Selanjutnya Ni Putu Arniati berusaha beternak babi. Akan tetapi jumlah yang sedikit serta masih menerapkan pola tradisional berakibat pada hasil yang masih kurang maksimal. Untuk mengatasi hasil yang kurang maksimal, Ni Putu memilih DINARI menjadi pendamping usahanya. Dari DINARI, Ni Putu Artini memperoleh pelatihan dan tunjangan modal usaha. Dengan pinjaman modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI sebesar Rp. 4.500.000.- ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian bibit serta biaya pakan ternaknya. Ni Putu Arniati optimis dari usaha ternak babi yang ia lakukan akan memperoleh keuntungan yang nantinya kan dipergunakan untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Ghulzar

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulzar is a low-income woman. She is 42, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region.

Ghulzar has a scanty herd of milk cows and sells 60 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and to the supermarket. The trade is good and Makhbuba sees that she could sell more milk. This requires more cattle in her herd.

Ghulzar decided to buy a calf to breed and hence to increase her monthly turnover. She has applied for a $600 loan to the Normicro Saatli branch to buy a calf and increase the number of cattle in her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: B. Dilorom is 37 years old and  lives in the B.Gafurov region. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. Dilorom has cancer but she is full of enthusiasm and is ready to work hard to ensure that her children have a happy future. She is engaged in a family livestock business where she makes and sells sour milk products.  Now Mrs. Dilorom requests a loan of 3500 TJS ($1,025USD) to purchase supplies and equipment necessary to open a trade outlet for her sour milk products.

loans.use: Open a trade outlet to sell sour milk products

loans.name: Ni Wayan Jendri

texts.id:
Seasonal income from farming is not enough to pay for Ni Wayan Jendri’s household daily needs and her child’s school tuition. That was why Ni Wayan Jendri and her husband decided to join DINARI’s pig breeding business to increase their household income. Through DINARI, which provides loan and training, Ni Wayan Jendri can buy 2 sows and 6 piglets for fattening. Six months later, each sow can bear 8 piglets, which can be sold for $25 each after being grown for 2 more months. All 8 piglets will bring $400 in sales, while the 6-month expense of each sow is $50. Thus, from each sow, she can expect a monthly profit of $50. With this extra income, Ni Wayan Jendri will no longer struggle to meet her family’s welfare like today.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari - hari beserta seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah, penghasilan musiman dari bertani tidaklah cukup untuk memenuhinya. Untuk mengatasi itu semua Ni Wayan Jendri beserta suaminya memutuskan untuk ikut program beternak babi yang DINARI adakan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga. Melalui DINARI yang memberikan pinjaman modal dan pembinaan, Ni Wayan Jendri dapat membeli 2 ekor induk dan juga 6 ekor bibit penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Dari pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan, induk babi bisa beranak 8 ekor yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250. 000.- per ekor setelah dipelihara selama 2 bulan. Hasil penjualan 8 ekor itu mencapai Rp. 4.000.000,- Selama enam bulan induk babi menghabiskan biaya sebesar Rp. 500.000,- Jadi dari 1 ekor induk dia mendapatkan tambahan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000,- per bulan. Dengan tambahan pendapatan seperti ini maka Ni Wayan Jendri tidak lagi merasa keberatan untuk mengatasi keadaan ekonomi seperti sekarang ini.

loans.use: To buy a sow and piglets

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en: O. Rohat is a relatively new client of  MicroInvest. She trusts the MicroInvest loan process. Mrs. O.  is married and has 3 children. She is engaged in a family business selling livestock and a wide assortment of food products. The main income producer is the livestock trade, but Mrs. O. also makes her own sour-milk products.  Now she is applying for a new business development loan in sum of 2500 TJS ($725USD) to purchase one more pedigreed milk-cow.

loans.use: Purchase another pedigreed milk cow

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 36236

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Simpir

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Sampir (49) lives alone all her life. Despite being unmarried, she diligently supports herself through breeding pigs. At the start of her business, Ni Nyoman Sampir used her own savings to build a permanent pigpen and buy 2 sows. After mating, each sow bore 8 piglets within 3 months. Two months later, each piglet was sold for $25. Looking at this encouraging result, Ni Nyoman Sampir was very excited and wanted to expand her business. This time, she will need some fund to build another pigpen and buy more sows. Ni Nyoman Sampir also plans to hire someone to help her when her business is growing. She will be thrilled and proud of herself when that day comes because, not only that she will grow her income, but also will she provide employment opportunities for others.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Simpir, 49 tahun, hidup seorang diri hingga usianya yang sekarang ini. Walaupun tidak mempunyai suami, ia tetap tekun dalam menjalani hidup dan usahanya, yakni beternak babi. Awal mula usahanya, Ni Nyoman Simpir bermodalkan dengan tabungannya sendiri. Dari modal tabungan tersebut, ia bisa membuat kandang babi yang permanen dan membeli 2 induk babi. Setelah induk babinya itu dikawinkan, selama 3 bulan berikutnya induk babi tersebut melahirkan dengan jumlah anak per ekornya sebanyak 8 ekor anak babi. Selama pemeliharaan 2 bulan, anak babi tersebut bisa dijual dengan harga per ekornya adalah Rp. 250.000.- Melihat hasil yang didapatnya, Ni Nyoman Simpir sangat antusias dan berencana untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Saat ini ia membutuhkan dana untuk membuat kandang babi lagi dan sekaligus membeli induk babi. Ni Nyoman Simpir juga berencana untuk mengajak seorang tenaga kerja untuk membantunya nanti kalau usaha nanti bisa berkembang. Ni Nyoman Simpir merasa senang dan bangga kalau nanti usaha bisa berkembang, ia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak lagi dan sekaligus menyediakan lapangan pekerjaan bagi sesamanya.

loans.use: To buy sows and build pigpen

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en: Ms. Nazaket is a 34-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle in her yard with her husband. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other dairy products. Nazaket wants to increase their number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Z. Marifat lives in the Khujand. She is 48 years old and has been in business for 10 years. Mrs. Z. sells an assortment of clothing for children and men. She is a serious business woman with a stable income that has allowed her to repay her previous loans on time. Now Mrs. Z. requests a loan of 3100 TJS ($900USD) for importing new goods and expanding the assortment of clothing she offers.

loans.use: Expand selection and import new goods

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Wati

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Wati’s husband, I Made Suja, is a middle school teacher whose income barely pays for his family needs. Because of this, Ni Nyoman Wati would like to find a new source of income to increase their household income. That was why she joined DINARI’s pig breeding program, which provides training before the loan is disbursed in order to prevent unnecessary usage of the fund. With this loan, Ni Nyoman Wati will buy 2 sows and pig food. In the next 6 months, each sow will bear 8 piglets. That means, in 6 months, Ni Nyoman Wati can have a total of 16 piglets, which can be sold for $25 each, and yield about $100 monthly profit, which will be used to help pay for her family expenses. Ni Nyoman Wati hopes that her pig breeding business will grow even more with time so that she will no longer struggle to make ends meet and pay for her children’s school tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Wati adalah istri dari I Made Suja yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai seorang Guru di sebuah Sekolah Menengah Pertama yang penghasilanya pas – pasan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan penghasilan seprti ini Ni Nyoman Wati menginginkan untuk mencari pendapatan baru untuk dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarga. Oleh karena itu Ni Nyoman Wati memutuskan untuk ikut memelihara babi yang didukung oleh program DINARI. Salah satu kelebuhan yang ada di program ini adalah adanya pelatihan dan pembinaan sebelum modal diberikan. Hal ini untuk mencegah penggunaan dana pinjaman untuk keperluan lain yang tidak berguna. Dengan kredit yang diperoleh, ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian 2 ekor Induk dan pakan ternak. Selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan Induk Babi ini akan melahirkan rata-rata 8 ekor. Sehingga dengan demiki selama 6 bulan pemeliharaan Ni Nyoman Wati menghasilkan 16 ekor anak babi yang bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Dari hasil penjualan keuntungan yang akan diperolah sebanyak Rp.1.000.000.- per bulan. Keuntungan itu ia manfatkan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Ni Nyoman Wati berharap kedepan ia akan dapat lebih mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya dengan memelihara induk dan penggemukan. Jadi dengan demikian jelas ia tidak kesulitan lagi dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sekaligus biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: To buy 2 sows and pig food

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id:
Looking at their farming results, Ni Ketut Sidantri and her husband realized that their farming income was insufficient to meet their increasing family needs. To solve this, Ni Ketut Sidantri decided to breed pigs. She chose to partner with DINARI. With the $500 loan, she is planning to buy piglets and pig food. Ni Ketut Sidantri is optimistic that her new pig breeding business will yield $350 in 6 months. This will definitely increase her family income so that she can help pay for her family expenses and her two children’s school tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Dari hasil pertanian yang selama ini ia kerjakan dalam keluarganya, Ni Ketut Sidantri bersama suaminya memandang bahwa hasil dari bertani belumlah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Ini dikarenakan peningkatan kebutuhan sehari - hari semakin meningkat. Untuk mengatasi hal tersebut, Ni Ketut Sidantri memutuskan untuk memaksimalkan usaha dalam bidang peternakan yaitu memelihara induk babi dan penggemukan. Untuk itu Ni Ketut Sidantri memilih DINARI menjadi pendamping usahanya. Dengan pinjaman modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI Sebesar Rp. 4.500.000.- ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian bibit serta biaya pakan ternaknya. Ni Ketut Sudantri optimis dari usaha ternak babi yang ia lakukan akan memperoleh keuntungan usaha sebesar Rp. 3.500. 000.- / 6 bulan. Ini jelas akan mampu menambah pendapatan keluarga didalam memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sekaligus biaya sekolah dua orang anaknya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.name: Yaakar 2 Group

texts.fr:
We became a women's group that decided to create an enterprise for selling grain in our eco-village and in the area where we live. After the experience acquired from our first loan that SEM granted to our Association, which has many members, we decided to set up this group with the intention, in the near future, of becoming an effective enterprise, given the support of Kiva and of SEM. Last winter's rainy season was catastrophic for growers. And this drove us to the idea of creating a shop for redistributing food stuffs. This communal enterprise will enable us to work together for the success of our business.

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Nous sommes devenues un groupe de femmes qui a décidé de faire une entreprise de vente de céréale dans notre écovillage et dans les alentours de notre zone d'habitation. Après une expérience acquise lors du premier prêt que SEM a accordé à notre Association qui compte beaucoup de membres, nous avons décidé de mettre sur pied ce groupe qui prétend devenir dans un futur proche une entreprise performante ghrâce à l'appui de Kiva et de SEM. La saison des pluies du dernier hivernage était catastrophique pour les agriculteurs. Ce qui nous pousse à avoir l'idée de créer une boutique de redistribution de denrées alimentaires. Cette entreprise commune nous permettra de travailler ensemble pour la réussite de notre affaire.

loans.use: Commerce in grains

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Zainab M.. In 2007, Zainab established a general store. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, and other goods in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, oil, and other goods for her general store

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Rehema R.. She is widowed and has three children, aged 18, 27, and 28.

In 2000, Rehema established a business selling disinfectant and charcoal. Rehema has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange "mkaa" (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, which makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of disinfectant and charcoal in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Lydia M.. She is widowed and has five children, aged between 14 and 22.

In 2001, Lydia established a livestock business. Lydia has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now she requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital--clients can start with one or two and either add to their stock or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can be either sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

Situé à 70 km de Dakar, le village de Ngaparou s’installe à l’ouest du Sénégal sur la station balnéaire.
Les activités dominantes  restent l’agriculture et la pêche.
De nos  jours, avec le déficit pluviométrique, les populations s’adonnent à la pêche et à d’autres activités génératrices de revenu, et dans cette même  lancée, s’inscrit le village dans le cadre du développement durable.
S’inscrivant dans cette logique, le groupement s »est trouvé pour activité : Culture biologique d’algue marine et production de pain, gâteaux, et jus a base d’algue marine. 
Ces produits ont des qualités nutritives telles que : le fer, le magnésium, la protéine, l’iode etc...
Le résidu des produits peut être réutilisé pour produire du savon local. 

Objectifs : 
Créer  des emplois qui puissent retenir les jeunes et qui sont générateurs de revenus et en même temps améliorer le cadre de vie en participant à l’hygiène environnementale. Rendre le village en zone de production biologique grâce à l’exploitation des Algues 

Activités :
Culture biologique d’algue marine et production de pain, gâteaux, et jus a base d’algue marine.

loans.use: Achat de matières premières pour la Production et vente de nouritures biologiques

loans.name: Gulaman

texts.en:
Gulaman (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.

She and her family settled in the Fizuli region, in the village of Kayidish, specifically built for IDPs. Seven years ago, they started this business. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy a cow in order to continue her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Rose K.. She is single and has two children, aged 21 and 28. She also has two other dependents who are her nieces.

In 1990, Rose established a poultry business, and she now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks, as well as feed and vitamins to help raise them. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital--clients can add to their stock or wait for them to multiply naturally. Second, they require little space. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can be either sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Suubi Kinawa B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fiona N.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy poultry feed. Fiona is 26 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 6 and 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Fiona makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct another poultry house.

Fiona is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Jesca N., Birabwa Namuga, and Justine N.. Sarah N. has a handcraft business and wants to add to the business. Jesca N. is currently operating a handicraft business and wants a loan to boost business. Birabwa Namuga operates a retail shop business and wants to add capital stock. Justine N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Suubi Kinawa C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Erina N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Erina is 29 years old and is single. She has two children aged 2 and 4. Each week, Erina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a piggery business.

Erina is joined in her small group by Rehema M., Betty Kayemba, Birabwa Namuga, and Getrude N.. Rehema M. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy chicken mash. Betty Kayemba is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to buy more hotel equipment. Birabwa Namuga operates a business of poultry farming and wants to add capital. Getrude N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B1 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hadijah K.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Hadijah is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 3 children ranging from age 10 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Hadijah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business.
