Hadijah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hadijah is joined in her small group by Justine N., Manat Asasira, Justine N., and Mary N.. Justine N. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to add more capital. Manat Asasira is currently operating a business selling firewood and wants a loan to expand the business. Justine N. operates a business of livestock farming and wants to buy animal feed. Mary N. is currently in the business of running a market stall and is requesting a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Fatmah

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Fatmah R.. In 2007, Fatmah established a clothing and cosmetics boutique. Working five to eight hours a day, five days a week, and assisted by two employees, she earns about $155 per month from this business. Fatmah now requires a loan in order to expand her range of clothes and bags. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $85. In the future, Fatmah also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing and bags for her boutique

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B1 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ann K.. She is currently in the business of operating a cosmetic's shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Ann is 33 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 12 and 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Ann makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another fridge. Ann has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ann is joined in her small group by Jackline T., Christine Dungu, Hadija N., and Agnes N.. Jackline T. has a business operating a beauty salon and wants to buy more salon equipment. Christine Dungu is currently operating a poultry farming business and wants a loan to boost business. Hadija N. operates a clinic business and wants to purchase more drugs. Agnes N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to uplift business.

loans.use: To purchase more brands of cosmetics and expand business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Janeth H.. She is married with five children, aged between 8 and 21. She has one other dependant, who lives with Janeth because her parents live in a remote area and have sent her to complete her schooling in Dar es Salaam.

Janeth runs a seamstress business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $175 per month from this business. Janeth has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now she requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth to sew new items for sale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $45. In the future, Janeth also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and sewing accessories

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Esta L., who has one child.

In 2005, Esta established a tailoring and DVD rental business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, and assisted by her partner and child, she earns about $160 per month from this business. Esta now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional DVDs and tapes for rent, as well as material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and tapes for rent, as well as material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu O.  is a 43 year old mother of 3. She hails from Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions and has been in business since 1999. She requests a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu O. l is a mother of 3 and is 43years old. She hails from Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions and has been in business since 1999.She needs a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Dorice W.. She is married and has two children, aged three months and nine.

In 2002, Dorice established a crafts business selling carvings. Working alone, she earns about TZS 145 per month from this business. Dorice has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $25. In the future, Dorice also plans to open another a business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is a 25 year-old single carpenter. He is requesting $525 to buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business. He has been a carpenter for three years and is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Musilimot

texts.en: Musilimot O. is 40 years old, married with 4 children and hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells and produce snacks e.g. fish roll, kpof-kpof and meat pies. She has been in business since 2004 and requests a loan of $450 to enable her buy  an oven and produce a large quantity.

loans.use: To buy an oven to enable her to bake meat pie.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias B. has been a carpenter for three years. He is 25 years-old and single.

He is requesting $525 to buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business. Mathias is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu B. is 40 years old, and is married with 3 children, ages 18,15 and 9. She and her husband also take care of two other people, age 9 and 60. She sells clothes and handbags.

In the past, Tatu has received and successfully repaid loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jariantu

texts.en: Jariantu L. is  a 52 year old married mother of 6 children. She hails from Mushin, Laagos state, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and has been in business for the past 30 years. She requests a loan of $450 to enable her to buy  foodstuffs for cooking.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Agibola

texts.en: Ajibola A. is 38 years old, married and has 4 children; she lives in mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells diesel and oil. She has been in this business since 1997. She requests a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more diesel & oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Diesel & Oil for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses B. is a 25 year-old single carpenter. He is requesting $525 to buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business. He has been a carpenter for two years and is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 45 years old and is married with 5 children, age 28, 24, 13, 9 and 5. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 5. Amina owns a small cafe, which she started in 2007. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business.

In the past, Amina has taken out and successfully repaid loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Mrs. Ken M., 25, currently operates a coffee and noodle shop with her husband, Mr. Lang Vyreak.  They earn an average profit of $10 a day. This couple plans to create another business by purchasing a booth to sell clothes in the market.  This stand will be run by Mrs Ken while Mr. Lang operates the coffee and noodle shop. Creating another business will allow them to produce additional profits. They are therefore requesting a loan from KIVA org. of $1000 to start this new business.

loans.use: To purchase a stand to sell clothes

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana has run a charcoal business for six years. Her suppliers get the charcoal from Bagamoyo and Morogoro regions, which are respectively north and west of Dar es Salaam. Due to the high rate of local deforestation, she wants to diversify her business and begin selling wood as well. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand into wood sales.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia H. is 33 years old, is single, and has one child aged 17. Her business is to sell clothes and food, and she does this every day from 10 am to 4 pm.

In the past, Sophia has taken out and successfully repaid loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To develop her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A. is a resident of Tandika area, a Dar Es Salaam suburb. She is a tailor, and runs a tailoring shop in Tandika municipal market where she makes clothing for women, men and children. She employs three people in the shop. She has four tailoring machines and would like to buy a new electrical tailoring machine.

She has been successful in her business in such a way that she is able to support her family and pay for her children's school fees. She is in need of a loan to help her buy a new machine and additional materials

loans.use: To buy an additional tailoring machine and new materials.

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo B. is 42 years old, and is married with 2 children. She is strong and focussed in her business, always wanting to improve her business style & income; this can be seen in her expression when she says ‘thank God KIVA loan is finally extended to me’. She sells drinks and provisions and is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her buy more drinks and provision for sale. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has two businesses located at Tandika market in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a food cafe and also sells used clothing. She has employed two people who help her in her businesses.

Her cafe accommodates close to six customers at a time, but Rehema needs a loan to help her expand her cafe so she can accommodate more.

loans.use: To expand cafe.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat O. is  married and has 3 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and clothes. She is 35 years old. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more drinks and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more ready made clothes for sale

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a resident of Makangarawe in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a store that sells new and used clothing and traditional attire called vitenge. She has been in this business for the past five years. She sells her items to the nearby residents of Tandika and also has a shop at a nearby trading center.

She has been successful in such a way that the profits she makes support her family and pay school fees. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Fund clothing business expansion.

loans.name: Masumba

texts.en:
K. is a 34 year old hard-working mother of three. She runs a small poultry farm that accommodates close to six hundred chicks. She has been doing this business for the past five years. She keeps both layers and broilers, though layers are more profitable than broilers. She supplies her eggs and chickens to restaurant owners and hotels.

She is in need of a loan of $USD800.00 to help buy more chicks, medicine for her poultry, and to build bigger housing for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, poultry medicines and bigger housing for poultry business.

loans.name: Kisura

texts.en:
Kisura is 40 years old and is single with one child aged 18 years old. Kisura sells clothes, a business she started in 2001. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business.

In the past, Kisura has taken out loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Asisat

texts.en: Asisat A. is a 42 year old mother of 4 children and is a strong and focussed woman. She has been operating this business for the past 15 years and is very familiar within her community and friendly with the people around her. Her longevity in this business gives her an edge over her competitor. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She requests a loan of $450 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: Adisa M. lives in Mushin, the heart of Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and a mother of 3. She sells bags of corn to neighboring shops. She has been a LAPO client for past 3years. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more bags of corn for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more Bags of Corn for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has a restaurant in the town of San Martin, El Dorado province, San Martín department, where she serves delicious foods typical to the region. She started the restaurant one year ago to help fund her two children’s education; her older daughter is at a university in the city of Tarapoto. Virginia is 43 years old and divorced and receives no financial help for her children’s education from her ex-husband. Virginia is a smart and hard-working individual. She started the restaurant with a few tables, chairs, a refrigerator, and $100. She now has a full kitchen and beautiful decorations covering the walls of the dining room. Her sales have steadily increased and she has hired her niece to help her out. She attributes her success to hard work and friendly service.

Virginia is part of the community bank Los Girasoles and is requesting a loan of $300 (S/. 800) to repay over a period of 6 months. With the loan, she will buy meat, beer, and sodas and improve her location. She is confident these investments will improve her business and increase sales. Virginia is happier and more confident and has big plans for the future. She has the goal of opening a new restaurant serving pollo a la brasa (rotisserie chicken) and french fries. The town of San Martin doesn’t have this type of restaurant but the food is very popular. She will continue to save until she can afford the grill required to prepare this food.

loans.use: Will buy meat, beer, and sodas and will improve her location

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Delfina T. V. is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay” microfinance institution. She has a small grocery store located at the Yungay fairgrounds.

With the loan of S/500.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase one sack of rice and 2 sacks of sugar.

Delfina is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband, who is a gardener, and her daughter. Both Delfina and her husband help out with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delfina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el negocio está ubicado en el campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay.

Con el préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un saco de arroz y 2 sacos de azúcar.

Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una hija y su esposo es jardinero. Ambos se apoyan con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de arroz y azúcar

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony S. is a carpenter by profession. He is married and has one child. His wife is a seamstress who is supporting her husband with the family’s finances.

Business is doing very well, and Anthony wants to buy more wood, which is an essential raw material of his work. He is asking for $525 as additional capital for purchasing more wood to manufacture furniture for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to manufacture furniture for sale.

loans.name: Fiori

texts.es:
Mrs. Fiori V. is a member of the “Nuestro Señor de Matha II” microfinance institution. She sells shoes for men, women, and children for a living. Her business is located in the district and province of Huaraz, in the Ancash department.

With the loan of S/1,300.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 3 ½ dozen pairs of shoes that she will sell to her customers. She sells her products door-to-door.

Fiori is 33 years old, married, and does not have any children yet. Her husband works for a private institution. Both Fiori and her husband are saving money so that they can have financial stability and a family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fiori pertenece al banco comunal "Nuestro Señor de Matha II". Se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños. El negocio está ubicando en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/: 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 3 1/2 docenas de calzado para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. La venta de sus productos lo realiza a domicilio.

Fiori tiene 33 años, es casada y todavía no tiene hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una Institución privada y ambos están ahorrando para poder tener estabilidad económica y tener familia.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Mrs. Ida O. is a member of the “El Progreso” microfinance institution. She runs a pharmacy where she sells medicine and toiletries for the whole family. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz, in the Ancash department.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase medicine and toiletries.

Ida is a 54-year-old separated mother of one son, who is now a professional. She was separated from her husband when her son was only 5 years old. On her own, she has been able to provide an education for her son and help him get ahead in life. They both live together, and she works arduously so that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Ida pertenece al banco comunal "El Progreso", tiene como negocio una Botica en donde ofrece a sus clientes medicinas y productos de tocador para toda la familia. El negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diferentes medicinas y productos de tocador.

Ida tiene 54 años, es separada y madre de un hijo que ya es profesional. Se separó de su esposo cuando su niño tenia la edad de 5 años y sola ha podido educar y sacar adelante a su hijo, viven los dos y sigue trabajando para que continúe creciendo el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of medication and toiletries

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae is 18 years old and is single with one child. Tukae sells chicken meat, a business she started in 2007. She works from 7 am to 1 pm every day at her business.

In the past, Tukae has taken out successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Mrs. Octavia belongs to the communal bank "Progress". She works in the restaurant business. Her store is located in the district and province of Huaraz in Ancash, which is a fairly affluent region. With the loan she receives, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy products to stock her store and give good service to her customers. She plans on buying 2 sacks of rice, a bag of sugar, 4 bags of noodles, 2 boxes of oil, soft drinks and other basic necessities like chicken, meat, etc.

Octavia is 40 years old and has been divorced for 20 years. She has a working daughter who Octavia educated herself. Every day she works so that her business keeps generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Octavia pertenece al banco comunal "El Progreso", se dedica a la venta de menú y platos a la carta y el negocio está ubicado en el Jr. 13 de diciembre en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash, la cual es una zona con bastante afluencia de publico. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos para poder abastecer su stock y poder brindar un buen servicio a su clientela, entre los productos tenemos, 2 sacos de arroz, 1 bolsa de azúcar, 4 bolsas de fideos, 2 cajas de aceite, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 6 unidades, 3 cajas de gaseosas personales y otros productos de necesidad diaria como pollo, carne, etc. Octavia tiene 40 años, es separada hace 20 años y tiene una hija profesional que ella ha educado sola. Día a día sigue trabajando para que el negocio le genere mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, pork, meat, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim C. L., 27, is the mother of one child and a vendor of grocery products in front of her house. She typically makes an average of $3.60 a day. Her husband, Mr. Yet Pet, 46, is a motor- taxi driver who earns about $3 a day of profit.  This couple plans to use the loan of $500 to purchase a vegetable stand at the market, which has a large  number of potential customers.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market to sell a variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat A. is a 48 year old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and drinks to the people in her community and she has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more clothes & drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & drinks for sale

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat A. is 48 years old, a mother of 4 children, lives in mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells cloths and drinks to the people in her community and she has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more cloths & drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cloths & drinks for sale

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest A. is a carpenter by profession. Business is moving well. He wants to increase his production, but he does not have adequate funds to meet his target.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more wood for manufacturing furniture.

loans.use: To buy more wood for manufacturing furniture for sale.

loans.name: Mwanvita

texts.en:
S. is a hard-working entrepreneur, residing in Tandika area, where she also does her business. She sells clothes, both new and used, and sells traditional attire on credit.

She is in need of Tshs 800,000 ($USD700.00) to help expand her business.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs. Olga C. is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay” microfinance institution. She sells groceries in the district and province of Yungay, in the Ancash department.

With the loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 5 bags of detergent, 5 boxes of soap, and 5 sacks of rice.

Olga is a 42-year-old mother of 4 children. Her husband does temporary jobs. The income they earn helps them provide their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 5 bolsas de detergentes, 5 cajas de jabón y 5 sacos de arroz.

Olga tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales. Sus ingresos que genera le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (detergent, soap, rice)

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario belongs to the communal bank "Progress". She works selling clothing, quilts, and towels, but invests mainly in the purchase of underwear for women, men and children. She markets her products to her friends and family going from house to house. Her business is located in Huaraz city, a province of Huaraz, in the Ancash region.

With the loan she receives, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy half a dozen sheets, 3 quilts, half a dozen jackets, half a dozen pairs of pants, and 8 dozen pairs of underwear.

Rosario is 52 years old, divorced, and a mother of 2 children. Her oldest daughter is married and her youngest is 5 years old. Living alone with her daughter, Rosario's enthusiasm and willpower have helped her business grow every day.

Translated by from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Rosario pertenece al banco comunal "El Progreso". Se dedica a la venta de ropa, edredones, toallas, pero invierte más el la compra de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Ofrece sus productos a sus amistades y familiares a quienes visita en sus domicilios. Este negocio se desarrolla en la ciudad de Huaraz, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 1/2 docena de sabanas, 1/4 docena de Edredones, 1/2 docena de casacas, 1/2 docena de pantalones y 8 docenas de ropa interior. Rosario tiene 52 años, es separada y madre de 2 hijos, la mayor ya es casada y la última tiene 5 años. Sólo con su niña, su entusiasmo y fuerza de voluntad le han ayudado para que su negocio crezca mucho más cada día.

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, quilts, jackets, pants, and underwear

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Mrs. Chang C., 44, is a mother of two children who works as a rice seller.  She normally makes a profit of $7 a day. Her husband, Mr. Deth Kneth, 46,  works as a farmer to supplement the household income, and can make up to $2 a day. Mr. Deth plans to purchase a mill to assist in grinding the rice crops. Grinding rice is a profitable activity. To buy this machine the couple has asked for a loan from KIVA of $800.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a mill.

loans.name: Fedha

texts.en:
Fedha is a mother of four and resident of Makangarawe area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been engaged in various business for the past 15 years. She sells traditional locally made clothing (vitenge and Kanga) and fried fish. She goes to the ferry every day for the fish and fries them in the evening for sale. She has employed one person to her help her with operations.

She is in need of Tshs 600,000 ($USD525.00) to help her expand her businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is a carpenter by profession. He is married and has one child. His business is doing very well and he wants to invest more in his wood manufacturing business.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more wood for furniture production.

loans.use: To buy more wood for furniture production.

loans.name: Alicia Yboni

texts.es:
Mrs. Alicia belongs to the Communal Bank of United Women located in the Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 37 years old and a mother to four young children. She is married and her husband is a mechanic. Alicia invested in the purchase of a motorized transport --a "motokar"--with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos.

Alicia actually has a mechanic workshop where she repairs motorcycles and transports. She works in the morning at an education center and in the afternoon at the workshop. With the loan she receives-- which she will repay in 5 months-- she will invest in the maintenance of her motokar and in procedural transportation documents.

Alicia herself shows that Manuela Ramos helps women advance themselves as the heads of micro-businesses in whatever trade they desire to undertake. The institution has enabled Alicia to support her family and be happy.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Av. Yarina Mz. C Lt. 10, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años es madre de 4 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es mecánico. Alicia con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra de un motokar. En la actualidad tiene una mecánica de reparación de motos y motokars. Alicia por las mañanas trabaja en un centro educativo y por las tardes se dedica a la atención de su taller de mecánica. Con el préstamo de S/1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motokar y los documentos de trámite de circulación.. Alicia manifiesta que Manuela Ramos ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse como micro empresarias en el negocio que desea emprender, además le permite apoyar a su familia y tener grandes satisfacciones.

loans.use: Compra de un activo (motokar)

loans.name: Dalis

texts.es:
Mrs. Dalis belongs to the 2nd San Fernando Communal Bank located in Calleria, in the Ucayali region. She is 62 years old and a mother to 6 children. She has always supported her children and is now divorced. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Mrs. Dalis invested in breeding chickens.

Mrs. Dalis has a shed where she breeds and tends to many chickens. She wakes up very early every day to feed and care for her chickens while at the same time she manages her home. With the loan she is requesting, Mrs. Dalis will invest in fixing her chicken shed and will buy more chickens and feed.

Mrs. Dalis is in good physical and economic health. Her business is doing very well and is providing her with the rewards she had hoped for. She is very thankful for the support that Manuela Ramos gives her.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Dalis pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Bolognesi Mz. P Lt. 1, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, pero siempre están apoyando a su madre y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la crianza de pollos. En la actualidad tiene un galpón donde cría muchos pollos, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para darles de comer y cuidar de sus pollos y a la vez también realiza las labores domésticas. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de su galpón y comprará mas pollos y comida balanceada. Dalis se siente muy bien tanto de salud como económicamente. Su negocio va muy bien y le está dando los frutos que esperaba y además está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To fix the chicken storage area and buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a hard-working entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze in the south central part of Ukraine. She started her small business about one year ago and has a little outdoor kiosk at the busy Central market in Ordzhonikidze. Clothing sales has been a good business as there is always a high demand for clothes. Ludmila has built up around $4000 worth of inventory on hand and makes about $400 in profit each month. Ludmila is married and has one child. Her business is a good source of income for her family.

Ludmila has requested an eight month loan to increase her working capital. We are happy for this opportunity to support Ludmila as she works to develop a stable and successful business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Filimina

texts.en:
Filimina is a tailor, and runs a tailoring shop where she has apprentices. She specializes in clothing for women and children. She has four machines, and with a new loan she hopes to buy a new modern multipurpose machine.

She is in need of Tshs 800,000 ($USD700.00) to help her buy a new machine and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy new equipment to aid business expansion.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya operates a profitable second-hand clothing sales business in the area around Stryi, western Ukraine. She started her business nineteen years ago when she didn’t have any work, and it has grown into a sizeable, successful business. Nataliya has several sales locations, one in the Central market in Stryi and several in nearby cities. Her husband also helps her with the business. They have two daughters, ages seventeen and four. 

Nataliya has requested a loan to help purchase inventory for a new sales location. She would also like to remodel the van that she uses with her business. This loan will give her the necessary capital to continue improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Mrs. Dora belongs to San Fernando's 2nd Communal Bank, located in the district of Calleria, in the Ucayali region. She is 47 years old and a mother to 3 children. Of her 3 children only 1 still depends on her. Mrs. Dora is married and her husband is a professor. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was invested in a grocery store.

In reality her shop is well stocked. Dora gets up very early to make breakfast and tend to the store. With the loan she requests, which she will repay in 5 months, Dora will invest in the purchase of 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of milk, noodles, preserves, candy, and soft drinks.

Dora is in good health. These loans come at a good time and serve as a buttress for her family's economic stability. For this reason Dora is very thankful for the aid that Manuela Ramos has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Dora pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Salaverry 898, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años, es madre de 3 hijo, de los cuales uno aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es profesor. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en una bodega. En la actualidad tiene una bodega mas surtida. Dora se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y luego para dedicarse a la atención de su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, fideos, conservas, golosinas y gaseosas. Dora se siente muy bien, los préstamos llegan en el momento oportuno y cuando uno mas lo necesita, además es un apoyo para la economía familiar y por ello está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is married with a daughter, Yana. She and her family live in Kherson where Natasha sells women’s clothing in the central market. She is very disciplined, analytical and organized. She communicates very well and has innovative skills which help her find new potential customers. Natasha has been in business for 10 years. She has promptly repaid 7 loans. Presently, her monthly net profit is about $5600. 

Natasha admits she needs financial support continue growing and developing her business. Today she is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase inventory and as a result, her revenue. Natasha is planning to continue to gain more loyal customers. We believe her communication and management skills will help Natasha achieve stability and success as well as financial independence. One of her long-term plans is to generate enough profit to purchase a nice separate apartment for her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith belongs to the community bank Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo # 507, district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, mother of 3 grown children, married and her husband is a merchant. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (USD$100) she invested is a small grocery store.

She currently is still working at the grocery store, getting up early in the morning to take care of the business and her domestic chores.

With the loan of 1300 Soles (USD $450), which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a sack of sugar, one sack of rice, a case of oil, milk, notebooks, soft drinks, gelatins and others.

Edith tells us that she feels very well, her business grows bigger every day and now she will be able to remodel her home and buy some things that she needs. She is also very grateful for all the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Edith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo Nº 507, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la pequeña bodega con la cual ya contaba.

En la actualidad continúa con la bodega, se levanta muy temprano para atenderla y simultáneamente comparte las tareas domesticas.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, leche, cuadernos, gaseosas, gelatinas, entro otros.

Edith nos dice que se siente muy bien, su negocio crece cada día mas y ahora podrá remodelar su casa y comprarse algunas cosas que le hacían falta, además está muy agradecida al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (sugar, rice oil, milk, etc)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kherson, Ukraine and runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the central market. Her kiosk is located in one of the busiest city markets where multiple vendors offer almost every imaginable product to passing customers. A beautiful array of assorted clothing attracts many clients to Victoria’s kiosk. She has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, she makes about $1200 in monthly net profit.  

Victoria is a hard-worker and a talented business manager. She has maintained an excellent credit history with Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. Victoris has repaid all 10 loans she has received from our organization. Victoria is very devoted to the success of her business and we believe she will have no problem keeping a excellent credit record with a new loan. Today Victoria is requesting the above amount to improve her business by stocking more clothing items which will allow her to expand her business and clientele. This financial contribution will not only increase her profitability, but it will go further and improve Victoria's and her family's social and economic status.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Mrs. Enma is a member of the community bank San Fernando 2, located on Jr. Sichi Roca 132, District of Calleria, and department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, mother of 6 grown children, married and her husband works as a driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (USD $100) she decided to invest is a business of buying and selling clothing.

Currently she works in the sale of clothing and vegetables, for which she travels along the banks of the Ucayali River to the different housing areas offering her products for which there is a high demand.

The proceeds of the loan of 1000 Soles (USD $350), which she will repay in 5 months, will go towards the purchase of clothing such as polo shirts, pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, shoes and a variety of vegetables.

Enma tells us that it is relief to work with Manuela Ramos because thanks to the loans her business and income are growing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Enma pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca 132, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es madre de 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de ropa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y verduras y para ello Enma viaja constante por las riberas del rio Ucayali a los diferentes caseríos ofreciendo sus productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual será pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como polos, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, zapatos y diversos tipos de verduras.

Enma nos dice que es un alivio trabajar con Mamuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos, tanto nuestros negocios como nuestras ganancias crecen.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya owns a small clothing sales business at the bustling Central market in Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for about seven years. Ludmila has proven to be wise with her finances and has built a successful enterprise. She currently makes about $500 per month and has $5500 invested in inventory.

Victoriya has requested a loan to add to her working capital. The clothing sales trade can involve a high amount of inventory turnover. This loan will give Victoriya necessary liquid capital so she can make investments in her business and continue to make good profits.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Mrs. Erika is a member of community bank La Amistad 2, located on Jr Libertad #820, Calleria district, department of Ucayall. She is 24 years old, mother of a minor age girl, married, and her husband is a merchant. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (about USD $100) she invested in first aid medications.

She currently works in the sale of medicines, this requires that she get up early every morning to take care of her daughter and husband and then go out to sell medicines door to door.

With the loan of 1500 Soles (USD $525) which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase different types of medications.

Erika feels very well and also has another reason for trying to get ahead and that is the pending arrival of her second child. She wants to give the new baby all the best and bring financial security for her family. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal De La Amistad 2, ubicado en Jr. Libertada Nº 820, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años, es madre de una hija menor de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en medicinas para primeros auxilios.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de medicinas, para lo cual tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a su hija y esposo y luego salir a vender sus medicinas a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de medicinas .

Erika se siente muy bien, además tiene un motivo mas para seguir adelante y es la llegada de su segundo bebe, al cual desea brindarle lo mejor y darle estabilidad económica a su familia, además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindando.

loans.use: Purchase of different types of medications.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children. She and her family live in Melitopol. Yelena sells household items and hats in the central city market. She is very serious and determined. Her great entrepreneurial skills and commitment to her business have helped her keep her sales high and costs low. The ability to give her customers what they want – such as high quality merchandise at reasonable prices – has helped Yelena keep loyal customers who come back over and over again. She has been in this business now for twelve years and currently has about $3,000 in inventory. Her working capital is about $2000 and her monthly profit is around $450. 
  
Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more inventory. She is hoping to invest the money she receives into further business growth. We believe her passion for business, enthusiasm in customer service and marketing skills, together with financial assistance, will help Yelena expand her trade and develop a strong, competitive business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicia belongs to the 2000 Women's Comunal Bank, located in the km. 3,800, district of Calleria, in the Ucayali department. She is 41 years old and she is divorced. She has three children, one of which still lives with her. With the first loan of S/. 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to start selling sweets and sodas. Currently she owns her own stand. Felicia wakes up very early in the morning in order to prepare breakfast for her children, and then she goes and works all day (sometimes even past midnight) in her business. With the loan of S/.2.300 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, Felicia will fix her stand and buy merchandise such as sodas, sweets, and other products. Felicia is a very hardworking woman. She puts all her efforts in order to provide the best for her children and improve her finances. She is very happy and very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the help that they have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del 2000, ubicado en el Km. 3,800, distrito de Callerìa, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, es madre de 3 hijos, el cual uno aún depende de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas y gaseosas. En la actualidad tiene un kiosco. Felicia se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y luego sale para ir atender en su negocio todo el día, inclusive en algunas oportunidades hasta la madrugada. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de su kiosco y además comprará golosinas, gaseosas, y otros productos. Felicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, todo el esfuerzo es para brindar lo mejor a sus hijos y mejorar su economía. Ella se siente muy feliz y está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: To fix her stand and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Georgina Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Georgina Virginia belongs to the comunal bank "San Fernando 2", located in the settlement of Martha Chavez Mz. O Lt. #15, in the district of Yarina Cocha in the Ucayali department. She is 57 years old, married (her husband is a saleman), and has 5 children, one of which still lives with her. With the first loan of S./ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she started her own convenience store. Currently she still has her business. She wakes up very early in the morning to make breakfast and work on her convenience store. With the loan of S./1,800 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy one bag of sugar, one bag of rice, one box of oil, milk, canned goods, and seasonings that she will sell in her store. Georgina states that she feels very happy working with Manuela Ramos, and that she is very thankful for all the help that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Georgina Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Martha Chávez Mz. O Lt. 15, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años, es madre de 5 hijos, el cual uno aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad continúa con la bodega. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y simultáneamente se dedica a la atención de la bodega. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, leche, conservas y condimentos. Georgina nos dice que se siente muy bien trabajando con Mamuela Ramos y está muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibe.

loans.use: To buy groceries  (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc) for her store.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortencia is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Ricardo Palma #383, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and is a mother of 3 children; one of them is still a dependent. She is married and her husband is a machine operator. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of soft drinks. Currently she continues with the sale of cold drinks such as sodas and ice; she also sells carbon. She gets up early to prepare breakfast and at the same time lend her attention to her small business with much care and dedication. She will use the loan of $516 USD to buy 5 boxes of soft drinks, 5 bushels of carbon, and 2 boxes of beer. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Hortencia says everything is doing very well in her business since her first loan. She is also very grateful for the support provided to her by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 394, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años, es madre de 3 hijos y uno de ellos depende aún de ella, es casada y su esposo es operador de máquinas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra y venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, hielo, también vende carbón. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la atención de su pequeño negocio con mucho esmero y dedicación. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 cajas de gaseosas, 5 sacos de carbón, 2 cajas de cerveza. Hortencia nos dice que desde su primer préstamo todo le está saliendo muy bien en su negocio y también está muy agradecida por el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, carbon and beer.

loans.name: Silbio

texts.es:
Don Silvio learned the trade of agriculture at a very young age, and dedicated his whole life to the production process of harvesting pineapple in his community of Ticuantepe, where he has been dedicated to harvesting the Monte Lirio variety of pineapple for thirty years. He taught his four sons the production process for harvesting pineapple, and during this time his family has acquired perfection in this process that requires much attention and dedication. They work many hours of the day in the fields.

The process of pineapple includes soil preparation, which requires a fertile soil, in order to guarantee the continued development of plantations. This requires a control of the vegetation, which must be maintained throughout the production process, to achieve or obtain the desired harvest during the middle of the year when the fruit grows in the cool climate. With the harvest collected by hand, Don Silvio offers his product at a retail price in his housing as well as the commercial area in the central market of the city. It is in this manner that he maintains and lives on the plots of lands he posesses.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don Silvio desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de agricultor, dedicándose toda su vida al proceso productivo del cultivo de piña en su comunidad Ticuantepe, en donde hace 30 años se ha dedicado al cultivo de piña de variedad Monte Lirio y el cual le ha enseñados a sus 4 hijos todo el proceso productivo que conlleva la producción de piña, a lo largo de todo este tiempo esta familia han adquirido perfección en dicho proceso que requiere de mucho cuido y dedicación, ya que trabajan largas horas todos los días en el campo. El proceso de piña parte de la preparación del suelo, en donde requiere una tierra fértil, la cual garantice el buen desarrollo de las plantaciones y para esto requieren de un control vegetativo el cual se debe de mantener en todo el proceso de producción, para lograr así obtener la cosecha deseada a mediados del año en donde por el clima fresco da su fruto. Ya con la cosecha en la mano, el señor ofrece su producto al menudeo en su vivienda y por mayor lo comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad, es de esta manera como subsiste y le da mantenimiento a las manzanas de tierra que posee.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer of nitrogen, potassium and phosphorous to harvest pineapple.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Don Juan is a producer with more than 26 years of experience. He lives in the municipality of Ríos, a community that offers fertile soil and hills that are used for the most part to cultivate pineapple, dragon fruit, coffee, platano bananas and vegetables, among other products that are supplied by the national markets in the city of Managua.

Mr. Don Juan cultivates pineapple and dragon fruit on the majortiy of his land, with the support of his eldest sons who know the harvesting process for these fruits. Each process of this type of work requires hard and technical manual labor , which his sons already know with perfection. In reality the plantations present difficulties for him to change his cultivations, due to a lack of economic resources to count on. The majority of the pineapple seeds that he poses is from five years ago, which does not provide a satisfactory product for his customers who purchase and consume them. Mr. Don Juan is asking for a loan in order to swo new pineapple and to obtain a better product for future commerce. With this investment in the harvesting of pineapple, he will improve his production and will then be able to increase his store and extend into new borders.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan es un productor de más de 26 años de experiencia, habita en el municipio de los Ríos, comunidad que presenta tierras fértiles y accidentadas que son utilizadas en su mayoría para cultivar piña, pitahaya, café, plátanos, hortalizas, entre otros productos que abastecen una buena parte del mercado nacional de la ciudad de Managua. El señor trabaja la mayor parte de sus tierras en el cultivo de la piña y pitahaya, con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores quienes conocen el proceso de cosecha de los cultivos que producen, ya que este tipo de trabajo requiere de mano de obra tecnificada que conozcan cada proceso, y sus hijos ya lo dominan a la perfección. En la actualidad las plantaciones presentan dificultades para poder renovar su cultivo debido a la falta de recursos económicos con los que no cuenta el señor, la mayoría de la piña que posee es de de cinco años, la cual no presenta un producto satisfactorio para los clientes que la compran y la consumen, el señor requiere un préstamo para sembrar piña nueva y obtener un buen producto para su futura comercialización. Con la debida inversión en el cultivo de piña, el señor mejorara su producción y así podrá incrementar su mercado y extenderse a nuevas fronteras.

loans.use: Purchase seed and chemicals to cultivate pineapple and dragon fruit

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Mrs. Ida is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Ricardo Palma #383, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 57 years old and is a mother of 4 children; one of them is still a dependent. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of beauty products. Currently she continues with the sale of beauty products. She gets up early to do her housework and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her products. She will use the loan of $688 USD to buy beauty products like lipsticks, eyeshadow, lotions, eyeliners, colognes, perfumes, etc. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Ida says she is doing very well and is having no difficulties. She feels very happy about her business and is also very grateful for the help she is receiving from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ida pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Jr. Ricardo Palma N° 383, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años, es madre de 4 hijos y uno de ellos depende aún de ella, es casada y su esposo es carpintero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de productos de belleza. Se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a las labores domésticas y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, como labiales, sombras, cremas, delineadores, colonia, perfumes, etc. Ida nos dice que todo le está yendo bien y sin ninguna dificultad. Ella se siente muy feliz por el negocio que tiene y además está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Mrs. Josefina is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, located on Jr. Comandante Suárez #318, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 38 years old and is a mother of 2 children who are still dependents; she is separated from her husband. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of fish. Currently she continues with the sale of fish and also owns a motokar. She gets up early to sell her fish and in the afternoons uses her time to do housework. She will use the loan of $688 USD to buy fish like tucunare, boquichico, marapate, paco, gamitana, doncella, jambina, etc. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Josefina is doing very well, and for that she is very grateful of all the support that the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso and especially Manuela Ramos have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Josefina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 318, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de pescado. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de pescado, también cuenta con un motokar. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a vender su pescado y por las tardes se dedica a las labores de su hogar. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará pescados como tucunare, boquichico, maparate, paco, gamitana, doncella, jambina, etc. A Josefina le está yendo muy bien y es por ello que está muy agradecida al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso y sobre todo a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia is part of the Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, located on Jr. Sinchi Roca 134, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 52 years old and is a mother of 7 children who are all of legal age. She is married and her husband works at the sawmill. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the sale of foods. Currently she owns a restaurant; she gets up very early to go to the market to buy the provisions she will need to prepare her meals. She will invest the loan of $861 USD in materials to better her shop and also buy sugar, rice, oil, condiments, vinegar, etc. She will repay the loan over the course of 5 months. Julia says Manuela Ramos helped her in the creation of her business with the good advice from her social worker and family. She feels very happy about the accomplishments she as achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca 134, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en un aserradero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la venta de comidas. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante, para ello se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado a comprar sus víveres que necesitará en la preparación de sus comidas. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en materiales para el mejoramiento de su local, así mismo comprará azúcar, arroz, aceite, condimentos, vinagre, etc. Julia nos dice que Manuela Ramos la ayudó bastante en la creación de su negocio con los buenos consejos de su promotora y la de su familia. Se siente muy feliz por los logros que está obteniendo.

loans.use: To purchase materials to better her shop

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucila is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Arequipa #175, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 41 years old and is a mother of 5 children- all of them already independent. She is married and her husband is a construction worker. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD she received from Manuela Ramos in a small seamstress workshop. Currently, she has a seamstress workshop at her house; she gets up very early in the morning to do housework and then spends her time tailoring clothes. She will use the loan of $344 USD to purchase fabric, elastic, lace, thread and fasteners. This loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Lucila is very happy because she does well in her business and also feels content working with Manuela Ramos because it is a good option for all women that want to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucila pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Jr. Arequipa N° 175, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, es madre de 5 hijos, todos ya independientes, es casada y su esposo es albañil. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad tiene un taller de costura en su casa, se levanta muy temprano para hacer las labores domésticas y luego se dedica a la confección de sus prendas. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de telas, elásticos, blondas, hilos y cierres. Lucila está muy feliz porque le va bien en su negocio y tambien se siente contenta por trabajar con Manuela Ramos porque es una opción para todas la mujeres que quieren progresar.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, elastics, lace, thread and fasteners

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. has been a seamstress for 3 years. She is married to a taxi driver and has one child.

She is requesting $525 to buy clothing materials to produce dresses and other clothes for sale. She hopes the loan will produce extra income to support her family.

Agnes is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials to produce dresses and other clothes for sale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz belongs to the communal bank "Women towards Progress," located in Calleria, Ucayali in Peru. She is 61 years old, the mother of 5 grown, independent children, and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 soles, she decided to invest in buying and selling corn.

Currently, she continues selling corn, but she also purchased a motorbike to contribute more to her income. She gets up very early to go buy corn and supplies for her daily sales.

With this loan for $625, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 20 sacks of corn and the rest will be used to maintain her motorbike.

Luz told us that she began selling chickens, which went very well, but later she decided to switch to buying and selling corn, which is yielding good results a it helped her purchase her motorbike. She finds herself pleased because at last she can enjoy the economic stability she has waited so long for. She is a fighting women and an example to everyone to follow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 474, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre de 5 hijos, todos independientes y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de maíz.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de maíz, pero también compro un motocarro para contribuir mas a sus ingresos económicos. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a comprar maíz y víveres para su venta diaria.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 20 sacos de maíz y lo restante lo destinará al mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Luz nos contó que empezó primero vendiendo pollos, le fue muy bien, pero después se decidió por la compra y venta de maíz que le está dando buenos resultados porque le ayudó a comprar su motocarro. Se encuentra feliz por que al fin puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que tanto esperaba y además es una mujer luchadora y todo un ejemplo a seguir.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and maintenance of her vehicle (motorbike)

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Estela belongs to the communal bank “La Amistad 2”, which is located in the Jr. Libertad #820, district Calleria, in the Ucayali department. She is 56 years old, divorced, and has three older children. She invested the first loan of S/.300 that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of second-hand goods. In her current business, she sells and repairs all sort of products. She wakes up very early to open up her business (she has numerous clients), and generally she does not close till 8 pm. With the new loan of S/. 1000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy products such as radios, TVs, irons, rice cookers, etc. Luz Estela feels very good about working with Manuela Ramos because they help all women who want to get ahead establish their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Estela pertenece al Banco Comunal De La Amistad 2, ubicado en Jr. Libertad Nº 820, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años, es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de artefactos de segunda . En la actualidad se dedica a la venta y reparación de todo tipo de artefactos. Se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, ya que goza de mucha clientela, y generalmente se queda hasta las 8 de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de artefactos, como radios, televisores, planchas, ollas arroceras, etc. Luz Estela se siente muy bien trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque dice que es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que quieren salir adelante y emprender su propio negocio.

loans.use: To buy electronic products

loans.name: Maria Ades

texts.es:
Mrs. María Ades belongs to the communal bank "San Fernando 2" located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 33 years old, and the mother of six young children. She is married and her husband is a public employee. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 soles, she decided to invest in buying and selling Omnilife products.

She currently continues to sell Omnilife products, and she also relies on two motorcars. She gets up very early to spend her mornings taking care of the household, and in the afternoons, she dedicates herself to selling her products in-house.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in 5 months, she will invest in buying clothing such as polos, pants, dresses, skirts, shoes, and Omnilife products.

María tells us that Manuela Ramos is a support for many business. Being here, she is happy to share her moments of happiness with her other companions at the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marìa Ades pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca 171, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 6 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es empleado publico. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos omnilife.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de productos omnilife , ademàs cuenta con dos motokar. Se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse por las mañanas a las labores del hogar y por las tardes de dedica a la venta de sus productos a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como polos, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, zapatos y en los productos omnilife.

Maria nos dice que Mamuela Ramos es un apoyo para los negocios ya que el estar ahí la hace sentir feliz al compartir momentos de alegría con sus demás compañeras del banco comunal.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and Omnilife products for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the communal bank "Women towards Progress," located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 46 years old, and the mother of five children, two of whom are still dependent on her, and she is married. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in food sales.

Currently, she continues to sell food and juices, and she also sells merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and jewelry. She gets up very early to go to the market to buy what she needs for her business, and in the afternoon, she goes out to sell her merchandise (clothing).

With this loan for $700, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase a blender and a juicer, utensils for juice-making such as glasses, a display case, plastics, and the rest she will invest in buying clothing.

Maribel is very happy now that she can contribute to paying her household expenses and the education of her children, who are her greatest joy. Her husband, too, is happy for the advances they have made and they are very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maribel pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Prolongación Cahuide Nº 248, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años es madre de 5 hijos, dos aún dependen de ella y es casada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de comida, jugos y también vende mercadería como ropa, cosméticos y alhajas. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo que le hace falta para su negocio y por las tardes sale a vender su mercadería (ropa).

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 licuadora, 1 extractora, implementos para la juguería como vasos, 1 vitrina, plásticos y el resto D. capital lo invertirá en la compra de ropa.

Maribel está muy feliz, ahora puede contribuir en los gastos de su hogar y en la educación de sus hijos, que son su mayor alegría. Su esposo también se siente feliz por ella por los logros que está obteniendo y está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Purchase of assets (blender, extractor, glasses, case) and purchase of clothing

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad belongs to the "Women towards Progress" communal bank, located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 48 years old, has one dependent child, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small sweets shop.

Currently, Natividad has a very well-stocked grocery store. She gets up very early to go to market and buy what she needs for her store, while at the same time dedicating herself to her household work and attending her customers.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one box of milk, one bag of detergent, one box of soap, one case of oil, sweets, sodas, etc.

Natividad told us that she began selling caramels in a small board she had, and with a lot of hard work and dedication she made her business grow. She is very pleased to be able to contribute to her home's economic well being, and her family is very happy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Jr. Luís Escavino Nº 161, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años, es madre de 1 hijo que aún depende de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en una pequeña venta de golosina. En la actualidad Natividad tiene una bodega muy surtida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar lo que le hace falta para su bodega, simultáneamente se dedica a las labores del hogar y a la atención a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 caja de jabón, 1 caja de aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Natividad nos contó que empezó vendiendo caramelos en un pequeño tablero que tenia y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hizo crecer su negocio. Está muy feliz de poder contribuir a la economía de su hogar y su familia está contenta por ella.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc)

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nimia belongs to the "Women towards Progress" communal bank, located in Callería, Ucalayi in Peru. She is 41 years old, and has three children, two of whom are dependent on her, and she is separated. With her first loan from Manual Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in selling food.

Currently, she continues to sell food. She gets up very early to go to market and buy the products for selling food.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase plates, cutlery, jars, vases, and serving dishes, and she will invest the rest in ingredients for making her meals.

Nimia told us that at first, things didn'g to well, but now her business is improving, and she feels happy, thanks to Manuela Ramos and all the support that they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nimia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Prolongación Cahuide Nº 107, Distrito de CallerÍa, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, es madre de 3 hijos, dos aùn dependen de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad continúa vendiendo comida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los productos para la venta de comida .

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará platos, cubiertos, jarras, vasos, fuentes y el resto de capital lo invertirá en los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.

Nimia nos contó que al principio le iba un poco mal, pero ahora su negocio está mejorando y se siente muy felíz gracias a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase of food prep items - plates, cutlery, jars, platters, etc.

loans.name: Norita

texts.es:
Mrs. Norita belongs to the communal bank San Fernando 2, located in Calleria, Ucayali in Peru. She is 48 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom still still depends on her, and is separated from her spouse. With the first loan she received through Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 Soles, she decided to invest in selling food.

Currently, she counts on a business selling plastics in addition to her restaurant. She wakes up very early to go to market and buy the ingredients that she will serve later to prepare her foods for sale that afternoon.

With this loan for S/. 2000 Soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will invest in expanding her restaurant, and she will buy plastic utensils to stock her business.

Norita is very content because her business has more customers everyday, thanks to the deliciousness of her food, and she is very grateful for the support that Manuel Ramos brings her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norita pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en el Km. 6,300, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, pero uno aún depenD. D. ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 soles deciD. invertir en la venta D. comida.
