His friends have advised him to turn to Microinvest for money. Osimjon has already taken out one loan to purchase more goods and it now applying for another one in order to expand his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Осимджон женат имеет троих детей. Его товар привозят друзья. Его товар состоит из продуктов питания. Он арендует магазин, ему нужны были деньги, его друзья посоветовали обратиться в Микроинвест. Так как после зимы торговля шла очень медленно, и ассортимента товара был не так уж велик. По совету друзей он получил кредит, он приобрел товар. Теперь ему необходимо расширить и увеличить свой ассортимент.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B1 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock to the shop. Betty is 29 years old and is single. She has 1 child aged 3. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to the business. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to expand the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Sophia N., Rose K., Martha N., and Farida N.. Sophia N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to add working capital. Rose K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to boost business. Martha N. operates a poultry farming business and wants to buy poultry feed. Farida N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth materials and fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and expand business

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
N. Tuhfa was born in 1965 in the B.Gafurov region. She is married and has a child. Mrs. N. rents a stall in the Khujand in the one of the large flea bazaars. She sells a wide assortment of clothing for children, men, and women.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $625 to modernize her business. She wants to import new goods such as house slippers, pajamas, and bathrobes.

loans.use: To modernize her business by importing new items of clothng

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 44 years old, is married with five children, ages ranging from 12 to 21 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 15 and 21 years old. Grace started a beauty salon in 2007, and everyday, she works from 4am to 7pm at her business.

In the past, Grace has taken out loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B2 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Janat M.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of items. Janat is 35 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 9 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Janat makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a public pay phone. Janat has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Janat is joined in her small group by Safina K., Betty N., Nalongo N., and Rose Nambi. Safina K. has a business operating a market stall and wants to add more food. Betty N. is currently operating a beauty salon business and wants a loan to add capital. Nalongo N. operates a poultry keeping business and a beauty salon and wants to boost both businesses. Rose Nambi is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To expand retail shop business

loans.name: Amina's Mtanzania Group

texts.en:
Amina, 23 years old, is married with one 5-year-old child. Amina started selling clothes in 2007, and everyday, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business.

In the past, Amina has successfully taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Khamid

texts.en:
K. Khamid lives and works in Khujand. Mr. K. sells his goods for commercial use, so he has a stall in the largest food bazaar in the region. He sells macaroni, spaghetti, salt, and the plastic packages. He is also a very experienced carpenter, so he sometimes sells hand-made objects.

Mr. K. has 10 years of business experience. He is applying for a loan of $1050 to develop his business by importing more goods.

loans.use: To develop his business by importing new goods

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B2 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jassy K.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to build a brooder. Jassy is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 21 to 25. Each week, Jassy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy poultry feed. Jassy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to add to the poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jassy is joined in her small group by Florence Z., Rosette N., Josephine N., and Teo B.. Florence Z. has a business in clothing sales and wants to expand the business. Rosette N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales as well and wants a loan to add capital. Josephine N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to purchase a hair dryer. Teo B. is currently operating a piggery business and is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: To add to poultry business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 28 years old, is married and lives together with her husband. Fatuma has been selling clothes since 1996. Everyday, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B2 C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Samalie N.. She is currently in the business of operating a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand business. Samalie is 28 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 4 and 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Samalie makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a modern hotel. Samalie has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the hotel and the loan was paid back on time.

Samalie is joined in her small group by Amina K., Gorette N., Sophia M., and Racheal N.. Amina K. has a business selling spare parts and wants to boost business. Gorette N. is currently operating a bar and restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase more beer and raw food. Sophia M. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to add capital stock. Racheal N. is currently in the business of operating a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To add to hotel and boost business

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en:
J. Gairat is 25 years old, and he lives in the B.Gafurov region in Tajikistan. Mr. J. works in the Khujand and rents a mini-market there. He offers an assortment of goods such as bedspreads, roller towels, tea towels, bath towels, children bicycles, office equipment, and mobile telephones.

Mr. J. is requesting a loan of $1200 for a shop in the new modern market that is opening in the B.Gafurov region.

loans.use: To open a shop in the new modern marketplace

loans.name: Luzinga East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lydia S.. She is currently in the business of operating a grocery store and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Lydia is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children aged 3 and 5 and her children go to school. Each week, Lydia makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and build larger premises for her business. Lydia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Lydia is joined in her small group by Florence M., Margret B. and Zaituni W.. Florence M. has a business running a grocery store and wants to boost business. Margret B. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add more stock. Zaituni W. operates a grocery store business and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To add stock to grocery store

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy J., 56, works as a market-vendor selling fish and typically makes up to $50/day in revenue. She must get up very early in the morning to purchase fish at her local fishery dock, and then returns to resell them at the market. Her husband works as a farmer growing vegetables and paddy rice. He generally makes only $1.50/day from selling his outputs at a market.
Tuy J. has eight children, two of whom work as mechanics. The other two are enrolled in school and the remaining four are married and live outside the family home. Mrs. Tuy J. hopes to use this loan to expand her business by increasing the size of her inventory to raise her profit. She also plans to buy another plot of farmland to expand her husband’s work as well.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok T. is 26 years old, and married. She works at a grocery store, where she sells a variety of products to members of her community. On average, Mok can earn a total of $5 in profits each day. Her husband works as a fisherman and can earn around $5 a day as well by selling his fish in the market. Mok would like a loan to improve the range of her products and meet the ever rising demand from her customers. With this loan, Mok will be able to stock more items, allowing for her customers to choose from a wider selection.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.en:
N. Nazar is 48 years old and he is married and has 5 children. Mr. N. is a very diligent and responsible father who works hard to ensure a good future for his children.

He is engaged in the family business that his parents started. Mr. N. raises and sells livestock, and his wife helps him by making the sour-milk products. Mr. N. is requesting a loan of $625 to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop

loans.name: Asha's Songambele Group

texts.en:
Asha, 33 years old, is married with two children, ages 16 and 11. Asha owns a general store that she started in 2003. Everyday, she works at the store from 7am to 6pm.

In the past, Asha successful took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum T., who is 56, is married with six children and works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice and vegetables. They have more than ten years of experience in cultivating crops. One of their children is employed by a garment factory; another one works for a private company as a driver; two others are unemployed and the rest of their children are married and live outside the family home. Mrs. Chum T. hopes to use this loan to purchase farming supplies including fertilizers, pesticide, and seeds to enable her to keep up her cultivations’ outputs. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chum T. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase her farm supplies.

loans.name: Luzinga East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hanifah N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Hanifah is 29 years old and is married to her husband, who is a teacher. She has 2 children, aged 2 to 5, and only one goes to school. Each week, Hanifah makes approximately UGX 36000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve her business. Hanifah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hanifah is joined in her small group by Phoebe Mwebazap, Jennifer K. and Juliet N.. Phoebe Mwebaza has a business in retail shop and wants to add in capital. Jennifer K. is currently operating a business in selling maize and wants a loan to boost business. Juliet N. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to expand business.

loans.use: To expand retail shop business by adding more stock

loans.name: Num

texts.en:
Mrs. Num L., 47, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She works as a house wife cooking food for her family members. Her husband, Mr. Yim Chun, works as a construction foreman making on average, around $12 each day. Additionally, one of her children works as a blacksmith, two are garment workers, and the rest of whom are unemployed.

Mrs. Num L. is humble to request for a loan to purchase more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work. She believes the new tools will reduce his labor force and make his job much faster and more productive.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a vending space and to buy a bench, a table, and utensils

loans.name: Kumry

texts.en:
J. Kumry lives in the B.Gafurov region, and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. sells cloth. She has a wide assortment because she sells the material for making the national dresses.

Mrs. J. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she has successfully repaid her loans and improved her business. Now she is applying for a loan of $1200 for 8 months to import a wider variety of good cloth to sell.

loans.use: To import a wide assortment of cloth for selling

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng N., who is 36, works with her husband as farmers growing rice, beans, and lettuce on her piece of farmland and collectively make about $10 per day from selling their outputs to a market. Sreng N. has four children who are enrolled in school and she has requested for a loan to purchase farming tools and a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools and a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.name: Luzinga East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nubu N.. She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to boost business. Nubu is 36 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 1 and 2. Each week, Nubu makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and educate her children. Nubu has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nubu is joined in her small group by Esther N., Jennifer N. and Lamula N.. Esther N. has a business running a grocery store and wants to add capital. Jennifer N. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to expand business. Lamula N. operates a business of selling silver fish and wants to add working capital.

loans.use: To add to maize business

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang S. is 47, and the mother of seven children. She and her husband live in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia, where they work together on the family plot of farmland. They grown rice and a variety of fresh vegetables which they sell on the open-air market, earning a total of $4 in profits each day.

Three of Leang’s children are employed at a garment factory. Leang would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other necessary items to support her business and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To  purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticide, and gasoline to supply her blooming cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an extra table and chair, cooking oil, a cooler box, fish, transport, and the municipal permit to operate her business

loans.name: Luzinga East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica M.. She is currently in the business of operating a beauty parlor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics. Monica is 45 years old and is married. Her husband has a barber's shop. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 months to 7 years old, and her children go to school. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and sustain them financially. Monica has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Monica is joined in her small group by Fazira M. and Rose N.. Fazira M. has a business selling maize and wants to purchase more sacks of raw maize. Rose N. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To add to a beauty shop and boost it

loans.name: Luos

texts.en:
Mrs. Luos N., 37, works growing rice and vegetables and sells them at a nearby market. She can generally make about $6 each day, while her husband can make on average around $5 a day in revenue from his fishery work.

Luos Naran has five children, including the one who will be born in the next three months. Two of her children are currently employed by a garment factory and the rest of her children are too young to attend school. Because she is pregnant and is not able to work on her rice field, her husband has to take care of her and does all the work himself.

Recently, this couple has requested a loan to purchase some farming supplies including fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, and gasoline to improve their production. This couple plans to save a lot of money to give their children better lives.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham C., 33, sells grocery products next to her house everyday, and earns around $13 of income. Her husband, Mr. Chun Sei, 35, is a taxi driver, who makes an average of $5 per day. Their two children are both students. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products, in order to diversify their selection.

loans.use: This couple hopes to this loan to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. E., 36, is a seamstress who sews at her house in Tnoat Chrum village, Boung Tompon Sangkat, Phnom Penh city. She has ten members in her family. Her husband, Mr. Sam Savan, is a driver of a three-wheeled- motorcycle taxi . To earn a living for her family, she works very hard everyday. 

She now needs a loan of $300.00 to buy a new motorcycle for her husband’s business operation. His increased income will improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a three-wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Bahaddin

texts.en:
Bahaddin is a 39 year-old man who is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in the Fizuli region. He settled in the Mahmudliu village.

This hard-working man is married and has two children. Seven years ago, he started this business. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy a calf in order to improve his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Beoun

texts.en: Mrs. Beoun M., 59, is married with four children and works as a fish seller in the market generally makes about $10 of profit a day on average. To contribute the daily expenses her husband Mr. Hean Huy, 62, works as a fisher man normally makes a profit of $5 a day. One of their children works as a waitress in Phnom Penh City. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a net. This net costs about $500 and the rest of the money will be used to buy boat generator. They believe that they would earn more profit to send the younger brothers and sister to school.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase net and boat generator.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha T., 45 years old, is single with four children, ages 27, 24,18 and 15. Ash owns a food vending store that she started in 1989. Everyday, she works at her store from 6:30am to 5:00pm.

Previously, Asha successful took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Luzinga East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aidah N.. She is currently in the business of selling rice wholesale and is requesting a loan to add working capital. Aidah is 40 years old and married to her husband, who is a tailor. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Aidah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and also educate her children. Aidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aidah is joined in her small group by Miria B. and Sida K.. Miria B. has a business running a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries. Sida K. is currently operating a business rearing cows and wants a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To increase capital to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Mrs. Keng K., who is 48, works as an animal breeder making  about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Nan, 51, is a taxi driver who earns around $3 per day. This couple has 6 children. One of the elder sons is a seller in the Poip Pet province and earns about $3 per day and two others work as garment workers and receive $50 each per month. To help the household, this family needs a loan around $250 to breed pigs.

loans.use: This couple use this loan to purchase pigs and resell for profit.

loans.name: Ruhiyya

texts.en:
Ruhiyya is a mother of two children. She is 38 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.

She resides in the Fizuli region where she settled in the village of Ahmadalilar. She has run this business for three years now. Currently, she needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Aslambeck

texts.en: A. Aslambeck is 27 years old and he lives in the Mastchokh region of Tajikistan. Mr. A. and his family  raise and sell ivestock. He has a large herd. Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder for his livestock

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S. is a 45-year-old grocer. She and her husband, Mr. Bin Sophal, live with her four independent children. Two of them are working at the garment factory with a basic salary of about $45 per month.

She would like to request a loan of $600.00 to repair her old and broken house.

loans.use: To repair their old and broken house

loans.name: Luzinga East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet M.. She is currently in the business of running a beauty parlor and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Harriet is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 2 children aged 8 and 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Monica N. and Florence M.. Monica N. has a business selling rice and wants to increase her working capital. Florence M. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To boost business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong Sineng is 48, and owns a pharmacy shop. She works as a doctor, and earns a total of $5 a day in profits. Her husband, Sim Sareth, is 47 and works as a rice seller. He earns a total of $3 a day in profits. The couple has two children, both of whom are students. Kong and her husband are requesting a total of $800 to raise pigs, to increase their income.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to breed pigs

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea P., 35, is a mother of five children. She works as a housewife who cooks for her family. Her husband works as a construction foreman at a construction site, and makes an average of $4 per day. Two of her children work as chefs, and make about $100 per month. Another one of her children is a bus driver, and the remaining two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Chea P. will use her loan to buy construction tools for her husband. In addition, she plans to install protection for her house from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy construction’s tools for her husband and install her house to prevent flooding during a rainy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase potatoes, baking flour, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, a frying pan, and raw materials to construct a stand

loans.name: Haw's Kitomondo C Group

texts.en:
Judith, 39 years old, is married with two children, ages 10 and 12. Judith started selling clothes 2 years ago, and everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business.

In the past, Judith has taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Luzinga East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Peninah R.. She is currently in the business of goat rearing and is requesting a loan to expand business. Peninah is 36 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 2 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Peninah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Peninah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Peninah is joined in her small group by Dorothy M. and Daniella Nakisuyi. Dorothy M. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Daniella Nakisuyi is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To buy more goats and expand business

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
N. Malika was born in 1975 in the Mastchokh region of Tajikistan. For 6 years, Mrs. N. has had her own store in the flea bazaar selling children's clothes and toys. She has a good assortment and sells at low prices.

Mrs. N. has been one of the most active clients of MicroInvest since 2004. The business and income stability helped her repay previous loans on time, and improve her business. Now Mrs. N. is applying for a loan of $1200 to import and sell pitch, which is a profitable business.

loans.use: To import and sell pitch

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. Chen N., 47, collects raw materials to sell to the recycling plant for profit. She earns about $2 a day. Her husband Mr. Son Wa, 51, sells srambled eggs for about a 5 dollar profit a day. Because scrambled eggs are very popular in their village, he hopes to increase the number of eggs he can sell. She will use the loan to buy more eggs for her husband so they can increase their income and their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase eggs.

loans.name: Mnuka C Group

texts.en:
J. A., age 36, is married with four children (ages 16, 14, 8 and 1). He has a tailoring business which he started 13 years ago. He opens from 8am to 6.30pm daily and makes a monthly profit of approximately $393.

In the past, J. took out one loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to expand his business. He now hopes for a new loan to buy more sewing machines for his business. He wil share this loan with his sub group members who have businesses selling fuel, clothes and tailoring.

In the picture, J. is first from the left

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Nakulyaku East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Elizabeth K.. She is currently in the business of selling maize and is requesting a loan to add working capital. Elizabeth is 27 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 1 to 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Elizabeth makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Elizabeth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Elizabeth is joined in her small group by Janet B., Specioza K. and Aidah W.. Janet B. has a business of maize selling and wants to boost business. Specioza K. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Aidah W. operates a business of selling sugar wax and wants to add to her business.

loans.use: To expand maize business

loans.name: Tarzan

texts.en:
Tarzan is 35 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He resides in the Fizuli region, where he settled in the Dilagarda village.

Tarzan is married with two children. Seven years ago, he started this business to meet the demands of his family. Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Asrorhoja

texts.en: O. Asrorhoja lives in the Mastchokh region, and he is married and has 6 children. Mr. O. raises and sells livestock. He dreams of having a large herd to increase meat production and the self-made dairy goods. Mr. O. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase pedigree bulls.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree bulls to increase meat production and diary products

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom T., is married with two children and works as a farmer who earns $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sor Bun Thun, works as a television mechanic and earns $3.50 per day. This couple plans to purchase more land to grow a variety of vegetables. To buy the land, they are now requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Nakulyaku East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret B.. She is currently in the business of cattle keeping and is requesting a loan to expand business. Margret is 36 years old and is married. She has 5 children and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business and educate her children. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Joyce Z., Margret M., Florence M., and Edisa M.. Joyce Z. has a business selling clothes and wants to add to her working capital. Margret M. is currently operating a business selling coffee and wants a loan to boost business. Florence M. operates a retail shop business and wants to increase stock. Edisa M. is currently in the business of selling sugar wax and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cattle and buy cattle feeds

loans.name: Saidmahmad

texts.en: Saidmahmad S. is 36 years old, married and has 2 children. He lives in the Mastchoh region. He is engaged in the business of raising and selling livestock as well as cultivating and selling vegetables (potatoes, onions, carrots, turnips, beets, etc). Now Saidmahmad is requesting a loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: Purchase seeds

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 36522

loans.name: Zaujat's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Zaujat Z., 29, is married with two children, ages 1 and 2. In 2007, Zaujat started selling clothes, and she works everyday from 7am to 6pm at her business.

Previously, Zaujat had received a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling wood, selling items in a shop, and tailoring.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nakulyaku East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of coffee selling and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sarah is 38 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Catherine S. and Aidah N.. Catherine S. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to add to the business. Aidah N. is currently operating a business selling spare parts and wants a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add to coffee business

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.en:
Abduhalim U. lives in the Mastchokh region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three children.

Abduhalim has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He started his business practically from scratch, but now he has an “oshhona” in the crowded market-place/bazaar. “Oshhona” is a small restaurant offering the national foods, but the main course is the traditional national meal called “plov”. He prepares the courses according to the traditional recipes. Now Abduhalim is applying for a loan to purchase special equipment.

loans.use: Purchase special equipment

loans.name: Puch

texts.en: Puch H. is 55, married, and has six children. She works at home cooking and supporting her children, while her husband, works at the Siem Reap province as a commune officer. Together, the family earns about $4 a day from his work. Three of her children earn about $3 a day working in construction, while the other three are still in school. The couple is requesting a total of $400 to renovate and improve their house and living conditions.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to renovate their house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock and renovate her make-shift structure

loans.name: Nakulyaku East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Glades M.. She is currently in the business of running a butchery and is requesting a loan to boost business. Glades is 47 years old and is married. She has 1 child who goes to school. Each week, Glades makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child and build better premises for her business. Glades has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Glades is joined in her small group by Olivia B., Olivia N. and Mariam N.. Olivia B. has a business in maize milling and wants to increase the stock of maize. Olivia N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Mariam N. operates a retail shop business and wants to add capital.

loans.use: To add more capital to butchery business

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: Shahodat S. lives in the Mastchokh region of Tajikistan; she is married and has three children. Shahodat  is engaged in commercial service and trade. She trades women's and children's wear. She has a good assortment and straight suppliers, which is why she trades at prices that are lower than the bazaar prices. Now Shahodat is applying for a business development loan to purchase new goods.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek M. is 34 years old, and a widower. He is currently employed at a Coca Cola, and sells soft drinks for a profit of about $2 a day. Coca Cola is extremely popular in the Cambodian market, so he needs to increase his income by expanding his range of drinks. Unfortunately, he currently faces a large financial constraint. Ek would like to apply for a loan to increase the range of drinks he sells, and the quantity that he can market. Ek plans to use the profits he earns from his business to help send his son to a university, and purchase a new house for his parents.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase Coke from the company and resell to a small booth.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en: Tohirjon A. is 33 years old, is married and has 3 children. Tohirjon started his business practically from scratch, but now he rents a trade outlet selling children's wear and shoes. He has six years of experience in the business. Now Tohirjon is requesting a loan to import new styles and increase his assortment.

loans.use: To increase his assortment by importing new styles

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Rosalie A., age 35, is married and the mother of four. She has been in this business for nearly seven years. Thanks to her good management, she has considerably increased her bottom line in the course of 2007. She has also hired a girl, who helps her in her tasks. With the help of this loan, Ms. Rosaline Amablé would like to increase the size of her business by buying 20 bowls and some dinner plates.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Rosalie A. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Agée de 35 ans elle exerce ce commerce depuis bientôt 07 ans. Grâce à sa bonne gestion elle a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaires au cours de l’année 2007. Elle a aussi engagé une jeune fille qui l’aide dans ses tâches. A l’aide de crédit, madame Rosaline Amablé désire augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant 20 bassines et des plats à manger.

loans.use: To buy 20 bowls and 5 cartons of dinner plates

loans.name: Nakulaku East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Margret is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and improve business. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Annet Kituuyi and Jaliat N.. Annet Kituuyi has a business selling clothes and wants to increase stock. Jaliat N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Kadiba Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene K.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Irene is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 2 children aged 15 and 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and add to her business. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Betty K. and Hadijah N.. Betty K. has a hair dressing business and wants to buy more hair oils. Hadijah N. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Kadiba Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of operating a canteen and is requesting a loan to add stock. Sarah is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 1 child. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child and boost business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her hotel business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Zulaika N. and A. Balimuguhra. Zulaika N. sells fish and wants the loan to expand business. A. B.is currently operating a photo studio business and wants a loan to add more capital and boost business.

loans.use: To add more food and edibles to the canteen

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak S., 49, is a mother of seven children and works making Khmer noodles.  She typically earns around $1 a day. Her husband Mr. Sok Chan, 52, sells groceries and vegetables in Prek Dak market making on average about $1 a day of profit. Mrs Prak wants to loan $600 to purchase a motor bike so that she can transport her goods to customers farther away.  The rest of the money will go towards increasing her stock.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase a motor-bike and grocery products

loans.name: Kadiba Central C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Faridah N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Faridah is 30 years old and is a widow. Each week, Faridah makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build better business premises. Faridah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Faridah is joined in her small group by Hanifah N. and Madina N.. Hanifah N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Madina N. is currently operating a business in maize milling and wants a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She started the business practically from the scratch, but thanks to MicroInvest loans she improved her business situation. Now she rents a trade outlet in the flea market selling shoes and materials. She has a good assortment. Now she's applying for a loan to import new shoe models.

loans.use: Importing new shoes models

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To operate her business at a larger scale and obtain a food stall

loans.name: Kadiba Central D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce N.. She is currently in the business of selling sugar and is requesting a loan to boost business. Joyce is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a shop attendant. She has 2 children aged 5 and 10 and both go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to support her children and sustain herself. Joyce has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Leya K., Jennifer K. and Jalia N.. Leya K. has a business selling new shoes and wants to purchase more shoes for sale. Jennifer K. is currently operating a local brewing business and wants a loan to expand business. Jalia N. operates a grocery store business and wants to add more capital.

loans.use: To add to sugar business

loans.name: Kadiba South C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lukia M.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Lukia is 40 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from age 9 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Lukia makes approximately UGX 54000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and expand her business. Lukia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 700000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Lukia is joined in her small group by Lovinsa M. and Irene M.. Lovinsa M. has a business selling new clothes and wants to increase stock. Irene M. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital and boost business.

loans.use: Purchase more matooke from villages to sell

loans.name: Bath

texts.en: Mrs. Bath L., 45, works as a grocery vendor making an average of $1.50 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Moy Sareth, 46, works as a construction laborer making an average of $1 a day of profit to sustain and provide a better life for his family. They have 7 children, two of which work as laborers in Thailand normally earning around $2 each per day. Another one of their children is also a laborer but works in the Siem Reap province typically earning $1 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to buy housing supplies to build a house. They hope to receive a loan of $500 from KIVA.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase housing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his onion business

loans.name: Kadiba Central E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jalia K.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Jalia is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 17 and all of them go to school. Each week, Jalia makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to improve her business. Jalia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jalia is joined in her small group by Rose Mukarego and Madina K.. Rose Mukarego has a hair dressing business and wants to buy a dryer, hair oils and weaves. Madina K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase stock in the shop and buy a fridge.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to expand grocery business

loans.name: Boymahmad.

texts.ru:
Boymahmad N. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 41 years old, is married, has 3 children and a high school/technical education. He works as an elementary school teacher. In addition he is an orchard keeper. The season for planting fruit trees is starting and Boymahmad plans to get a loan to purchase small fruit trees and to plant them. His business provides locals with fresh fruits. He plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Боймахмад Мирзоевич проживает в районе Шахринау.Взраст 41 год, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-специальное. Работает по специальности учителем начальных классов.Кроме того занимается садоводством. Начинается сезон посадки фруктовых деревьев поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку черенков фруктовых деревьев и для их посадки . Его бизнес позволяет обеспечить население свежими фруктами. Погасить кредит клиент планирует погаситьв течении 12 месяйев.

loans.use: Покупка рассады.

loans.name: Kadiba South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fredali N.. She is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture and beer. Fredali is 38 years old and is married. Her husband trades in coffee. She has 2 children aged 2 and 5 and her children go to school. Each week, Fredali makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and add to her business. Fredali has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fredali is joined in her small group by Rebecca N., Mary T., Aidah N., and Sarah N.. Rebecca N. has a hair dressing business and wants to add to the business. Mary T. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase more shop items. Aidah N. operates a garment shop business and wants to boost business. Sarah N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more clothing materials.

loans.use: To add to bar business

loans.name: Mursal

texts.id:
Mursal, the father of a girl, works as an electrician (home installation technician). Through his work he has been able to support his wife and child. Nonetheless, he wants to increase his earnings. Currently in each installation job he is only compensated for the cost of service, because all the required parts have been purchased by the houseowner. If all the electric equipment was the responsibility of Mursal, his earnings would be twice what he used to get paid just for servicing - Rp. 50,000 (USD equivalent $5.40).

As a result, he has submitted for a loan of Rp. 3,500,000 (approx USD equivalent $400).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Bapak satu orang putri ini bekerja sebagai instalatir listrik. Dari hasil pekerjaannya selama ini dia sudah mampu menghidupi isteri dan anaknya. Namun, dia ingin mendapatkan penghasilan yang lebih besar. Dalam satu kali pemasangan, dia hanya dibayar ongkos jasa saja, karena semua bahan dibeli oleh pemilik rumah / villa. Seandainya semua bahan alat – alat listrik ditanggung oleh Mursal, keuntungannya 2 kali lipat dari jasa semula yang hanya dibayar Rp 50.000,00/titik lampu. Oleh sebab itulah dia mengajukan pinjaman senilai Rp 3.500.000,00.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as cables, bulbs, bulb caps,and other assorted items

loans.name: Zulayho.

texts.ru:
Zulayho M. lives in Vahdat. She is married, has 5 children and is 50 years old. Zulayho is a homemaker and raises livestock. She has 6 years of experience in this area. Zulayho plans to use her loan to purchase a dairy cow which will provide her with milk. She will sell the milk in her town, which will help her family’s finances. In addition, this will provide local residents with fresh milk at affordable prices. Zulayho plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусулмонова Зулайхо Рахмоновна проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем имеет 5 детей. Возраст 50 лет. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Опыт в бизнесе 6 лет.на планируемый кредит хочет купить дойную корову, что позволит ей получать молоко. Полученное молоко планирует использовать для продажи в городе.. Что поможет улучшить финансовое положение ее семьи.Кроме того продажа молока позволяет обеспечить население свежим молоком по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиентка планируе в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marziya.

texts.ru:
Marziya Z. lives in Vahdat. She is divorced, has 5 children and is 51 years old. Marziya works at the collective farm in her town. She works in agriculture, planting potatoes. February and the beginning of March is potato planting season and Marziya has asked for a loan. She will use her loan to purchase fuel for the tractor, fertilizer and potato seeds. She has 15 years of experience in this area and her business is the main source of income for her family. In addition, the expansion of agriculture provides local markets with fresh vegetables at affordable prices.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зайдуллоева Марзия проживает в городе Вахдат.Разведена имеет 5 детей.возраст 51 год.Работает колхозницей в колхозе города Вахдат.Занимается растениеводством, посевом картофеля. Февраль и начало марта является сезоном посева картофеля, поэтому клиент решила обратится за кредитом.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку топлива , для трактора , удобрений и семян картофеля.Опыт в бизнесе составляет 15 лет. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода. Так же развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить рынки города свежими овощами по доступным ценам.

loans.use: Purchase fuel, fertilizer and seed for potatoes.

loans.name: Zulfiya.

texts.ru:
Zulfiya U. lives in Vahdata. She is 58 years old, is married, has 5 children and a high school education. She works on the collective farm in Vahdat and raises livestock. Zulfiya will use her loan to purchase calves for her business. At this time of the year livestock prices are falling due to a shortage of feed and it is thus currently profitable to purchase them and resell them in 40 days for a profit. Zulfiya will pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарова Зульфия проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 58 лет.замужем ,имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее , работает колхозницей в колхозе г. Вахдат.Занимается животноводством. На планируемый кредит хочет купить бычков для дальнейшей реализации.Сейчас время когда цены на животных падают из-за нехватки корма, поэтому покупать бычков в данное время выгодно. А после откормки через 40 дней можно продавать по более выгодной цене.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her green maize business

loans.name: Chinigul.

texts.ru:
Chinigul S. lives in Vahdat. She is 45 years old, is married and has 3 children. Chinigul has a high school education and is a product expert by profession. She sells clothing at the Vahdat market. Chinigul has 20 years of experience in this area and will use her loan to purchase new products to sell. Her business allows Chinigul to support her family and to provide locals with necessary products at affordable prices without having to leave the area.

Chinigul plans to pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шафоатова Чинигуль прживает в городе вахдат. 45 лет, замужем ,имеет 3 детей.Образование средне специальное.по специальности товаровед.Занимается торговлей одежды.Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Вапхдат.Опыт в данном бизнесе составляет 20 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести новый ассортимент товара. Этот вид бизнеса позволяет ей обеспечивать свою семью , а также позволяет обеспечить население необходимыми товарами по доступным ценам и не выезжая из данной местности. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase new products for sale

loans.name: Tumiani Group

texts.en:
The Tumiani Group is a group of male entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Kamutu B. is the leader of the group, and he runs a tea cafe that sells beverages and common Tanzanian snack food. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

Note: YOSEFO utilizes a group lending method.  Clients receive individual loans for their respective businesses as a part of a larger group.  The group method provides solidarity for lenders and increases repayment rate.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Tumiani Group

texts.en:
The Tumiani Group is a group of male entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Kamutu B. is the leader of the group, and he runs a tea cafe that sells beverages and common Tanzanian snack food. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

Note: YOSEFO utilizes a group lending method. Clients receive individual loans for their respective businesses as a part of a larger group. The group method provides solidarity for lenders and increases repayment rate.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Subhoniddin.

texts.ru:
Subhoniddin H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married, has 4 children, is 39 years old and works in agriculture. Subhoniddin plants potatoes and other vegetables and will use his loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. He has been in this business for 5 years, supporting his family and providing local markets with ecologically clean vegetables. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Субхониддин проживает в районе Рудаки.Женат , имеет 4 детей. Возраст 39лет .Занимается сельским хозяйством. Посадкой картофеля и других овощей. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить семена картофеля и удобрений.Занимается этим бизнесом клиент 5 лет, тем самым обеспечивая свою семью , а также рынки города экологически чистыми овощами.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en: The Upendo Group is a group of female entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Kimbaile A. is the leader of the group, and has a small business that sells firewood. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Shahlo.

texts.ru:
Shahlo H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married, is 31 years old and does not have children. Shahlo works in agriculture, planting potatoes and other vegetables. She will use her loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She has been in this business for 10 years, supporting her family and providing local markets with ecologically clean vegetables. Shahlo plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанова Шахло проживает в районе Рудаки.Замужем детей не имеет. Возраст 31 год .Занимается сельским хозяйством. Посадкой картофеля и других овощей. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить семена картофеля и удобрений.Занимается этим бизнесом клиентка уже 10 лет, тем самым обеспечивая свою семью , а также рынки города экологически чистыми овощами.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.en: Angela F.’s group is made up of four female entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Angela is the leader of the group, and she runs a bar that sells soda, beer, water, and other beverages. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Sadaf.

texts.ru:
Sadaf H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is divorced and has 8 children. Sadaf is 68 years old. She works in agriculture and plants potatoes and other vegetables. She will use the loan to purchase seeds for growing potatoes and to purchase fertilizer. Sadaf has been in this business for 40 years, thereby providing her family and local markets with ecologically clean vegetables. Sadaf will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанова Садаф проживает в районе Рудаки.Разведена имеет 8 детей.Возраст68 лет .Занимается сельским хозяйством.Посадкой картофеля и других овощей. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить семена картофеля и удобрений.Занимается этим бизнесом клиентка уже 40 лет, тем самым обеспечивая свою семью , а также рынки города экологически чистыми овощами.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Ulhanoy.

texts.ru:
Ulhanoy U. lives in the Rudaki region, she is 45 years old, is a widow and has 5 children. Ulhanoy has a high school education and works in agriculture. She will use her loan to purchase a dairy cow and will use the milk for her family and to sell to others. She has 10 years of experience in this area. This business helps her family and helps local residents to get fresh milk at affordable prices. Ulhanoy will pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Улоева Улханой Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 45 лет , вдова, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее занимается животноводством. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку дойной коровы, чтобы получать молоко как для своей семьи так и для продажи.Опыт работы в данной деятельности 10 лет.Этот бизнес помогает ее семье ,а также позволяет населению получать свежее молоко по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ngunu Kazi Group

texts.en: The Ngunu Kazi is a group of entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Amosi Mgamga M. is the leader of the group.  She owns a food kiosk that sells soda and juice, as well as traditional Tanzanian snack food such as chips, chapatti, and somosa. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Saun

texts.en: Saun W. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She sells shoes and she has been operating this business since 1997. She is a LAPO member. She requests the loan of $450 to enable her buy more shoes for sale

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Kadiba South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma N.. She is currently in the business of selling rice at a wholesale level and is requesting a loan to expand business. Fatuma is 36 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children and both of them do not go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Aidah N., Zalika N., and Edith N.. Aidah N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to boost business. Zalika N. is currently operating a business in charcoal sales and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Edith N. operates a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock.

loans.use: Purchase more rice for sale

loans.name: Dodarbek.

texts.ru:
Dodarbek M. lives in the Rudaki region, he is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children. He has a vocational education. He is a welder and works in a private shop that makes metal products such as stoves. He has 25 years of experience, this profession is the sole source of support for his family and provides him with a decent income. Dodabrek will use his loan to purchase necessary instruments and materials (metal). He will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоев Додарбек Яридбекович проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 45 лет ,замужем имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-специальное. По профессии сварщик. Работает в частной мастерской по производству металлических изделий: печки, тапчаны и т.д. Опыт работы в данной сфере 25 лет.Этот вид деятельности единственный источник дохода его семьи.Кредит хочет получить для того чтобы купить необходимые инструменты и материал ( металл). Эта деятельность дает неплохой доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase instruments and materials

loans.name: Olanike

texts.en: Olanike Oladimaji is a 45 year old married woman with 5 children that hails from Mushin, in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. She started her business in 1992 and solicits for the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more foodstuffs for sale. She has been a LAPO client for years and she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mukumjon

texts.ru:
Mukumjon S.lives in the Rudaki region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has a technical education and is a driver by profession. He works as a taxi driver. Mukumjon has 28 years of experience and will use his loan for car repairs. Mukumjon’s job is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the area where he works has limited transportation and his job allows residents to move around the region at affordable prices and in comfort. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шамсов Мукумджон Раджабалиевич житель района Рудаки. Возраст 53 года. Женат имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности водитель –шофер. Работает водителем такси. Опыт работы 28 лет. Хочет получить кредит на ремонт автомашины. Его деятельность является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того местность в которой он работает не снабжена транспортом и его деятельность позволяет населению передвигаться по району по доступным ценам и с комфортом.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo B. is a 52 years old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells engine oil, diesel & kerosene. She has been a member  LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to buy more engine oil, diesel & kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil, diesel & kerosene

loans.name: Kadiba South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Esther B.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth material and fabrics. Esther is 40 years old and is married. Her husband has a maize milling business. She has 1 school going son. Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct better business premises. Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Esther is joined in her small group by Faridah N., Hanifah W. and Suzan K.. Faridah N. has a business in tailoring and wants to buy a sewing machine. Hanifah W. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Suzan K. operates a beauty parlor business and wants to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: To add to tailoring business and expand it

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo F. is a 40 year old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is focussed and is planning to expand her business if the requested loan is granted. She has been a LAPO member for the past 2 years. She sells drinks & provisions. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to buy more drinks & provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & provisions

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is business oriented, she sells building & furniture materials in her locality. She has been operating her business since 1996. She solicits for the loan of $450 to buy more building & furniture materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more building & furniture materials for sale

loans.name: Fotima.

texts.ru:
Fotima A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 38 years old, is married, has 4 children and has a high school education. She sells dairy products and owns a trading point in her region. Fotima purchases products from residents and sells them at the market. She would like to get a loan to increase her inventory. This business is the main source of income for Fotima’s family. In addition her business helps locals to purchase fresh dairy products at affordable prices. Fotima will pay back the loan during a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Фотима проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 38 лет Замужем ,имеет 4 детей.образование среднее. Занимается торговлей молочных продуктов. Имеет торговую точку в том же районе. Она скупает товар у населения и реализует на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот .Ее деятельность является основным источником дохода ее семьи.Кроме того торговля в селе позволяет населению покупать молочные продукты свежие и по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase products

Nzimina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nzimina is joined in her small group by Esther N., Betty Tikubakya, and Rose K.. Esther N. has a restaurant business and wants to buy more raw food and soft drinks. texts.ru:
Mahmadsharif P. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 42 years old, is married, has 4 children and a high school education. Mahmadsharif plants wheat. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He has 3 years of experience in this area. Agriculture helps to provide local residents with wheat and flour and allows Mahmadsharif to support his family. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Махмадшариф Кучарович житель района Хуросон. 42 года ,женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. loans.name: Groupement Gameli

texts.fr:
The GAMELI Group was created by these three gentlemen. They have been raising pigs for five years and are the main suppliers to the bars in the region. By the income from their work, each gentleman manages to support his family. This group has also employed five young men, who help them with their work. They would like to use these funds to increase the size of their herd by buying a dozen sows and five hogs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement GAMELI est créé par ces trois messieurs. Ils opèrent dans l’élevage des porcs depuis 05 ans et sont les premiers fournisseurs des bars dans la région. Par les revenus de leur activité chacun arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille. Ce groupement a aussi engagé 5 jeunes hommes qui les aident dans l’exécution de leur tâche. Ils désirent par ces fonds augmenter la capacité de leur troupeau en achetant une dizaine de truies et 05 cochons

loans.use: To buy five female pigs and ten males  pigs and also to enlarge the pig pen.

She is the secretary of her union for the past four years and has been in business for over five years. She needs a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma A.is married and 30years. She lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes calls, sells telephone lines, and recharge cards. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her buy more cards for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more phone lines and recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Lukoto East F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet M.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Annet is 38 years old and is single. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in the business. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to boost business and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Waiki N. and Kamuati M.. Waiki N. has a beauty parlor business and wants to purchase various types of cosmetics. Kamuati M. is currently operating a business of selling bread and wants a loan to increase working capital and purchase more bread to sell.

loans.use: To boost clothing business

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu I. is 35 years old, married, and has two kids. She lives in Isashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and baby items. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola A. is a fashion designer and also sells tailoring materials. She is 38 years old and a widow with two kids. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of $600 to enable her buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell.
